entrance 30 feet maximum permitted width of curb cut 40 feet class iii maximum permitted width of entrance 40 feet maximum permitted curb cut 70 feet 4 frequency a one per residential property b two per commercial unit if frontage is greater than 300 feet c additional driveway warranted if total ingressegress volume exceeds 1000 vpd 5 spacing a 105foot minimum for 25 miles per hour speed limit b 125foot minimum for 30 miles per hour speed limit c 150foot minimum for 35 miles per hour speed limit d 185foot minimum for 40 miles per hour speed limit e 220foot minimum for 45 miles per hour speed limit 6 curb radius a 20foot minimum e any time a parcel of land is cleared of existing surface improvement the driveways serving that parcel should be cleared or reconstructed to conform to the guidelines set forth herein    562014 twofamily driveway requirements individual driveways for twofamily residences may be separate or adjoining individual drives for twofamily structures are limited to the class 1 residential standard of 25 feet width at the property line and 30 feet at the curb cut adjoining driveways are limited to 50 feet at the property line and 55 feet at the curb cut the adjoining driveways may be separated by a twofoot green space extending the full length of the driveway from the property line to the garageparking space increasing the width at the property line to 52 feet and a maximum of 57 feet at the curb cut    562014 unusual conditions the planning commission is authorized to grant in writing variances from the strict application of driveway conditions and criteria provided it is determined that the following conditions are present a the exception or variance desired arises from peculiar physical conditions not ordinarily existing in similar districts in the city or is due to the nature of the business or operation on the abutting property  b that the granting of the permit for the exception or variance will not adversely affect the rights of adjacent property owners or tenants  c that exception or variance desired is not against the public interest particularly safety convenience and general welfare  d that the strict application of the terms of this chapter will place unnecessary hardship on the property owner or tenant    562014 pave granular drives all newly constructed or altered driveway approaches shall be of concrete hot mix asphalt or nonpermeable material intended to serve as a permanent drivable surface    562014 concrete aprons with sidewalks when city sidewalks are installed on the rightofway behind concrete curb and gutter the property owner shall construct the drive aprons in the public rightofway to be of adequate depth and design as determined by the director of public works within 60 days of the placement of the sidewalk    562014 roadside ditches a no roadside drainage ditches shall be blocked or filled by any property owner contractor or entity without an alternate approved by the director of public works to transport runoff and subbase road drainage b installation of ditch culverts under drives and streets shall require no less than a onefoot rise to a threefoot run on both the upstream and downstream ends of the culverts    562014 permit fees a fee will only be charged when a driveway approach is being done and that fee will be established by the common council and kept on file in the office of the city clerk the fee shall be doubled upon failure to obtain a permit before construction of a driveway begins    562014 interference with street structures no driveway approach shall interfere with any facilities utilities located in the road rightofway the owner shall be responsible for all costs associated with the relocation of such structures and the cost thereof shall be levied as a special charge against the abutting parcels of land    562014 violations  penalties a fine of $3500 per day for not meeting the requirements of this chapter will be imposed by the city public works director andor hisher designee the fines shall be imposed per day forfeiture citation served on the property owner the city of omro reserves the right to bring property into compliance and charges will be assessed against the property    562014 chapter 1216  street use permits footnotes  3  state law reference authority to grant street privileges wis stats   purpose the streets in possession of the city are primarily for the use of the public in the ordinary way however under proper circumstances the common council may grant a permit for street use subject to reasonable municipal regulation and control therefore this chapter is enacted to regulate and control the use of streets pursuant to a street use permit to the end that the health safety and general welfare of the public and the good order of the city can be protected and maintained prior a   application a written application for a street use permit by persons or groups desiring the same shall be made on a form provided by the city administrator and shall be filed with the city administrator the application shall set forth the following information regarding the proposed street use a the name address and telephone number of the applicant or applicants  b if the proposed street use is to be conducted for on behalf of or by an organization the name address and telephone number of the headquarters of the organization and of the authorizing responsible heads of such organization  c the name address and telephone number of the person or persons who will be responsible for conducting the proposed use of the street  d the date and duration of time for which the requested use of the street is proposed to occur  e an accurate description of that portion of the street proposed to be used  f the approximate number of persons for whom use of the proposed street area is requested  g the proposed use described in detail for which the street use permit is requested prior b   representative at meeting the person or representative of the group making application for a street use permit shall be present when the common council gives consideration to the granting of the street use permit to provide any additional information which is reasonably necessary to make a fair determination as to whether a permit should be granted prior c   review by chief of police and director of public works before any application for a street use permit is considered by the common council the application shall be reviewed by the director of public works and chief of police for their recommendation as to the affect that the temporary closing of the street will have on the public safety and traffic movement in the area during the time the street may be closed prior d   mandatory denial of street use permit 1 an application for a street use permit shall be denied if a the proposed street use is primarily for private or commercial gain auctions are exempted  b the proposed street use would violate any federal or state law or any ordinance of the city  c the proposed street use will substantially hinder the movement of police fire or emergency vehicles constituting a risk to persons or property  d the application for a street use permit does not contain the information required above  e the application requests a period for the use of the street in excess of six hours  f the proposed use could equally be held in a public park or other location 2 in addition to the requirement that the application for a street use permit shall be denied as hereinabove set forth the common council may deny a permit for any other reason or reasons if it concludes that the health safety and general welfare of the public cannot adequately be protected and maintained if the permit is granted prior e   permit fee each application for a street use permit shall be accompanied by a fee paid in accordance with the fee schedule on file in the office of the city clerk prior f   consent to issuance of street use permit in addition to the fee required by the section  each application for a street use permit except for parades or races sponsored by civic youth or scout organizations which have been in existence for at least six months shall be accompanied by a petition designating the proposed area of the street to be used and time for the proposed use the petition to be signed by not less than 75 percent of the residents over 18 years of age residing along that portion of the street designated for the proposed use prior g   insurance the applicant for a street use permit may be required to indemnify defend and hold the city and its employees and agents harmless against all claims liability loss damage or expense incurred by the city on account of any injury to or death of any person or any damage to property caused by or resulting from the activities for which the permit is granted as evidence of the applicants ability to perform the conditions of the permit the applicant may be required to furnish a certificate of comprehensive general liability insurance with the city the applicant may be required to furnish a performance bond prior to being granted the permit prior h   termination of a street use permit a street use permit for an event in progress may be terminated by the police department if the health safety and welfare of the public appears to be endangered by activities generated as a result of the event or the event is in violation of any of the conditions of the permits or ordinances of the city the chief of police has the authority to revoke a permit or terminate an event in progress if the event organizers fail to comply with any of the regulations in the street use policy or conditions stated in the permit prior i   chapter 1220  tree planting purpose the purpose of this chapter is to cause the orderly planting of trees within the corporate limits of the city under or near utility or high power lines on front rear and side yard terraces of residential homes and commercial businesses   part 1994 legislative intent it is intended by this chapter to establish regulations that regulate the planting of trees on the front rear and side yard terraces of residential homes and commercial businesses located in the corporate limits of the city   part 1994 conflict of provisions in their interpretation and application the provisions of this chapter shall be held to be the minimum requirements and shall be deemed a limitation or repeal of any other power granted by the wisconsin statutes where any terms or the requirements of this chapter may be inconsistent or conflicting the more restrictive requirements or interpretation shall apply where a provision of this chapter is required by wisconsin statutes or by wisconsin administrative where the chapter provision is unclear the provision shall be interpreted in light of the wisconsin statutes and the wisconsin administrative effect on the date of the adoption of the ordinance codified in this chapter or in effect on the date of the most recent text amendment to this chapter   part 1994 applicability the requirements of this chapter apply to all persons andor entities within the city corporate limits winnebago county wisconsin   part 1994 administration the provisions of this chapter shall be administered by the common council or its designee   part 1994 planting conditions  permit required a all trees planted in accordance with be by permit any tree species not specified on the permit or improperly planted shall be removed at the direction of the appointed agent for the city no permit will be issued for the following trees box elder silver maple and any member of the poplar family of tree b the permittee agrees to hold harmless the city against all claims demands liabilities damages or any other costs which may accrue as a result of the issuance and use of a permit   part 1994 planting standards a each tree shall be planted no deeper than it grew in a nursery as determined by the soil line on the trunk of the tree any broken or long roots should be pruned off planting should allow six inches of clearance around the trees root system b soil backfill should be added gradually allowing the trees roots to assume their natural position the soil backfill shall be tamped occasionally during planting leaving a dishshaped impression in the soil at the surface water well after planting and very heavily every tenth day after planting mulch may be placed around the tree base grass should not be allowed to grow within one foot of the tree trunk c usually newly planted trees should not be fertilized until the second growing season remove all broken branches but do not prune the central leader d support by use of stakes should be used when needed the supporting ties should be fastened to the tree so as to not cut or nick the tree trunk   part 1994 suggested shade tree species where no utility wires are located or a tree is not planted on a city street terrace no permit shall be required the following trees recommended to be spaced every 35 feet are permitted norway maples colummar emerald queen crimson king superform royal red etc  sugar maples  kentucky coffee trees  green ash marshall seedless newpoert summit  white ash autumm purple  lindens american little leaf chancelor greenspire redmond  thornless honey locust shademaster skyline  bur oak  american beech  hackberry   part 1994 required shade tree species any tree planted under a utility wire or on a city street terrace shall be by permit only minimum spacing between trees shall be 20 feet permitted trees are as follows amur maple tree form  apple service berry  hornbeam  thornless hawethorn  flowering crab american beauty delgo flame pink spires radiant silver moon and tschonoski  ironwood  canada red cherry  callery pear  japanese tree lilac   part 1994 violations  penalties and enforcement a any person who violates a provision of this chapter shall be provided with a violation correction notice that shall include the name of the property owner  address of the subject property  type of violation with reference to the proper omro city ordinance  what type of action must be done by the property owner to remedy the violation  and the amount of time allowed to remedy the violation but not less than ten days b in the event the property owner fails to comply with a violation correction notice within the requisite time a citation may be issued by city to collect a forfeiture the issuance of a citation shall not preclude proceeding under any other ordinance or law relating to the same or any other matter shall not preclude the issuance of a citation under this section c penalties for violating this chapter may be assessed as follows any person who violates this chapter shall be required to forfeit $5000 for a first violation $10000 for a second violation and not more than $50000 for a third or subsequent violation plus allowable court costs and costs of abatement incurred by the city   part 1994 chapter 1224  parks and navigable waters duties of the director of community services in relation to the parks department the director shall be responsible to promulgate the rules and regulations for the management operation and control of parks and related facilities and recommend appropriate fees and deposits to the office of the city administrator to ensure the safety protection and wellbeing of the properties operated by the parks department the director shall be governed and work within the guidelines provided by the parks committee as authorized under the omro municipal   part 2003 park regulations a purpose and definition in order to protect the parks parkways recreational facilities and conservancy areas within the city from injury damage or desecration these regulations are enacted the term park as hereinafter used in this chapter is defined to mean all lands and water heretofore and hereafter acquired by the city of omro for park or recreational purposes or placed under the jurisdiction of the parks department and includes without limitation parks parkways recreational facilities and structures watercourses which are or may be located within any area dedicated to the public use as a park playgrounds swimming pools any privately owned lands the use of which has been granted or leased to the city for park recreational or like public purposes or conservancy areas within the city limits b specific regulations 1 littering prohibited no person shall litter dump or deposit any rubbish refuse earth or other material in any park it is unlawful for any person to leave throw or break any bottle box refuse or other object except in clearly marked refuse receptacles provided for that purpose where receptacles for rubbish and refuse are not provided the person or group responsible for it shall carry all waste away from the park it is unlawful for any person to throw discharge or otherwise place or cause to be placed in the water of any fountain pond lake stream river or other body of water or on the ice thereof in or adjacent to any park any substance matter or thing liquid or solid which will or may result in pollution of such waters as defined by the department of natural resources 2 sound devices and amplification systems most park facilities are located within residential areas where a certain level of peace and quiet is expected and will be enforced therefore it is unlawful to use public address systems amplifiers or any other amplification device including amplified music in any park or recreation area after  pm except as provided herein amplifier or amplification device in this section means any machine or device for the amplification of human voice music or any other sound but shall not be construed to include standard vehicle radios or stereos when installed and when heard only by occupants of the vehicles in which the unit is installed while occupying that vehicle the use of radios stereos or other similar devices is expressly permitted except that the volume of sound shall be controlled so that it is not unreasonably loud disturbing or of such character intensity or duration that it is disturbing to any person within the range of audibility the human speech or music amplified shall not be profane lewd indecent or slanderous in nature this section shall not be construed to limit the authority of the omro police department to respond to complaints and to take any appropriate action in response thereto a exemptions 1 an exemption is allowed for an amplified sound or music activity that provides a substantial benefit to the public including but not limited to parades sporting events special community events public concerts fireworks displays and oneday nonprofit festivals that are open to the general public 2 an exemption is allowed for park pavilion rentals on friday and saturday nights allowing for amplified sound or music activity until  pm proof of rental permit must be provided upon request b variance a variance permit may be issued upon request provided that the activity producing noise is necessary to promote public health andor welfare and reasonable steps are taken to keep noise at the lowest practical level the criteria for granting of a variance shall be based upon finding of all of the following i the variance will provide a substantial benefit to the public generally and be open to public attendance  ii the source nature and duration of the proposed sound is not contrary to public health andor welfare  iii conditions exist that are beyond the control of the person applying for the variance  and iv no other alternative facility or method of operation for the event is available to the applicant a variance will not be issued if there are reasonable alternative locations for the event available to the applicant 3 bill posting no person shall post paste fasten paint or attach any placard bill notice sign or advertising matter upon any structure tree or other natural object in any park except park regulations and other signs authorized by the parks department or designees thereof 4 throwing stones and missiles prohibited no person shall throw stones or other missiles in or into any park except standard playground equipment designed and used as a throwing device such as balls and frisbees 5 removal of park equipment prohibited no person shall remove benches bleachers seats tables or other park equipment from any park unless prior written permission of the director of community services or designee thereof is obtained 6 trapping trapping when used in this section means and includes the taking or attempting to take of any wild animal by means of setting or operating any device mechanism or contraption that is designated built or made to close upon hold fast or otherwise capture a wild animal or animals the trapping of wild animals is prohibited in city parks unless authorized by the director of community services or designee thereof or under the direction of the department of natural resources or its designees 7 making of fires no person shall start tend or maintain a fire except in personal grills or designated fireplaces or fire pits unless permission is granted to allow fires in other areas by the director of community services or designees thereof and upon proper notification to the fire department personal grills shall be used only in designated picnic areas the use of personal grills is permitted provided lawns and vegetation are not endangered unburned fuel and ashes shall be disposed of in a designated container in such a manner as to prevent fire or damage to any park property fires must be attended at all times safely distinguished and remnants disposed of prior to vacating city park property 8 protection of park property a no person shall kill injure or disturb or attempt to kill injure or disturb waterfowl birds or animals wild or domestic within any park except as permitted by this section no person shall climb any tree or remove flowers or fruit wild or cultivated or break cut down trample upon remove or in any manner injure deface write upon or ill use any tree shrub flower flower bed turf soil sand water fountain ornament building structure apparatus bench table official notice sign fence or other property within any park b no person shall deface throw stones pebbles or other debris in any of the toilets bubblers or other sanitary facilities located in any city park  or deface by drawing with crayon chalk paint or anything else on any of the buildings or equipment at any city park  or deface the equipment by means of a sharp instrument 9 motorized vehicles except for authorized maintenance vehicles no person shall operate an unlicensed or licensed motorized vehicle outside of areas specifically designated as parking areas or areas where the operation of such vehicles are specifically permitted motor vehicles are restricted to the roads and drives and parking areas no person shall drive any motor driven vehicle upon the grass or trail or park any place other than upon the established roadways and parking lots unless authorized to do so by the director of community services or designee thereof no motor vehicles of any nature may be used on the seeded areas except vehicles which have been granted permission by the director or designee thereof and have police department authorization for shows rides or exhibits and then only for the purpose of loading and unloading 10 snowmobiles no person shall operate a snowmobile or other motorized recreational vehicle in a city park except in designated areas snowmobiles or other motorized recreational vehicles shall only be operated on designated trails 11 speed limit no person shall operate any vehicle in a city park in excess of ten miles per hour unless otherwise posted 12 reckless driving in parks prohibited no person shall operate a motor vehicle in a reckless manner in any of the public parks of the city no person shall endanger the safety of any person or property by the negligent operation of a vehicle or cause bodily harm to any person by the negligent operation of a vehicle and in accordance with wis stats  346621 13 dogs and domesticated animals dogs are allowed onleash within all cityoperated parks during normal park operational hours except park areas as specifically excluded per prohibited areas for animals which designates that a person owning or in charge of any animal shall not permit such animal to be upon cityoperated beaches cityoperated cemeteries sports fields ball parks and within or immediately surrounding the omro family aquatic center or any city park sand based playground area a all owners of authorized animals brought onto city park property must be in compliance with all animal control provisions as set forth within the omro municipal in accordance with all of the following regulations i the dog must be on a chain rope cord or leash of a strength that allows for the reasonable control and containment of such animal by the owner or person in charge of such dog  ii the length of the chain rope cord or leash shall not exceed six feet when the owner or keeper and the dog are within any city park or when proceeding along any pedestrian sidewalk or transportation corridor  iii the dog is licensed as required by is wearing a valid rabies vaccination tag as required by   iv the owner or keeper of the dog shall have in hisher immediate possession an appropriate device for scooping excrement and andor an appropriate depository for the transmission of excrement to a receptacle located upon property owned or possessed by such person this subsection shall not apply to owners or persons in charge of animals assisting visuallyimpaired hearingimpaired or mobilityimpaired persons  and v the owner or keeper of the dog shall remove and dispose of feces in compliance with this subsection shall not apply to owners or persons in charge of animals assisting visuallyimpaired hearingimpaired or mobilityimpaired persons b the provisions of this shall not apply to i animals as provided in wis stats  106521fm 3am1a  ii dogs used by or under the auspices of the city of omro police department or the winnebago county sherriffs department in the course of official police business c the director of public works shall cause signs to be posted in parks or park areas where dogs are permitted or prohibited 14 horse and carriages no person shall ride a horse or drive a horsedriven vehicle in any cityoperated park except on roads or designated bridle paths unless approval of the chief of police and the director of community services or designee thereof is first obtained it is unlawful for any person to ride a horse or drive a horsedriven vehicle in a careless negligent or reckless manner which may endanger the safety and wellbeing of others 15 feeding of geese waterfowl and animals it is strictly prohibited to feed geese gulls waterfowl or other nondomesticated animals within any city park no person shall feed or provide nourishment to any waterfowl or nondomesticated animal within any park nor attempt to domesticate any animal within any city park 16 removing tree protectors no person shall remove any device placed on or around a tree located in any city park that is used primarily for the protection or growth guidance of trees or shrubs 17 golfing and sporting activities no golfing or practicing golf in city parks or recreation areas shall be allowed no person shall participate in golf tennis or archery in any city park except upon areas specifically designated for such purposes 18 fees and charges the common council upon the recommendation of the parks committee shall have the authority to establish such fees and security deposits as deemed necessary for use of any park facility shelter boat launch watercraft mooring and docking facilities or land area it is unlawful to use such land areas or designated park facilities without payment of such fee or security deposit when required the schedule of rental facilities and respective fees as established by the common council shall be on file in the office of the city clerk and are adopted by reference 19 firearms  hunting and weapons hunting possessing or discharging of a weapon of any kind for any purpose including hunting is prohibited in all city parks specifically the use of firearms air guns paint guns bow and arrow slingshots knives swords explosives fireworks and weapons of every character except in areas authorized by the chief of police and the director of community services or designees thereof 20 fish cleaning no person shall engage in the act of cleaning fish in park shelters toilet facilities or picnic areas or on any public or park property cleaning fish on any park property is strictly prohibited it is unlawful for any person to dispose of any fish remains carcasses or entrails in a city parks refuse container 21 vendors restricted no person shall sell vend or give away in any city park any article of merchandise whatsoever without a written permit from the parks committee it is unlawful for any person organization group or association to vend sell peddle or offer for sale any foods refreshments commodities services or articles within any city park except by concession agreement authorization or authorization by the city council for major operations or by the authorization of the director of community services for minor operations daily or seasonal vendor permits are required daily permits for oneday events may be obtained from the office of the city administrator upon authorization of the director of community services or designees thereof seasonal vendor permits may be obtained by the office of the city administrator upon formal approval of the omro common council vending permit fees shall be established upon approval of the omro common council and shall be kept on file in the office of the city administrator 22 smoking and tobacco products  no person shall smoke or hold a lighted cigarette cigar or pipe in any no smoking area within any park or in any other area in any park where notices prohibiting smoking are posted it is unlawful for any person to use cigarettes cigars pipes or chewing tobacco within the boundaries of a designated playground structure or play area or to dispose of byproducts on or near playground perimeters chewing tobacco byproducts shall not be expelled onto any park property or into any park refuse container this section shall not be construed to limit the authority of the omro police department to control underage tobacco usage 23 camping no person shall camp in any city park in any automobile any vehicle which has accommodations for sleeping except watercraft possessing a valid permit for overnight docking or in any tent or sleeping bag in the open or in any manner unless authorized to do so by a waiver issued by the director of community services or designee thereof watercrafts that have a valid permit to dock overnight in designated mooring areas are not included but all persons must camp within the confines of the watercraft no person authorized to dock a watercraft vehicle overnight is allowed to camp anywhere on shore in the city park 24 interference with permittee no person shall in any manner harass disturb or interfere with persons holding written permits granted by the city of omro and their authorized agents for the use of parks shelter areas designated overnight watercraft mooring spaces boat launches or any other park facilities 25 swimming limitations no person shall swim bathe or wade in any of the waters of the fox river or its associated channels and tributaries within the city limits this includes but is not limited to either swimming or bathing in the waters of the lagoons at scott park or miller park or swimming in the fox river from the shores off any cityowned property prior      part 2003     932013 operation of remote or radiocontrolled toys or devices prohibited it is unlawful for any person to fly operate or make use of any remote or radiocontrolled model airplane helicopter vehicle or any other such device in over or upon any street park or other public property except in areas specifically designated and posted for such purpose and with the consent of the city prior     part 2003   1182011 turf protection on public property except as authorized by the director of community services or designees thereof no person shall dig into the turf of any cityowned park or recreational property for any purposes whatsoever or remove any trees or flowers absent authorization by the director of community services or designees thereof the use of metal detectors and digging for buried objects on city parks or recreational property is prohibited prior     part 2003 park hours a park closing hours  all city parks shall be closed from  midnight until  am the director of community services or designee thereof may approve of the conduct of functions within the parks beyond  midnight by private organizations or individuals in granting such approval the director of community services or designee thereof shall designate the area in which the function shall be carried on and shall indicate the person responsible for the conduct of such function no person shall be in any city park between the hours of  midnight and  am except in compliance with this section b exceptions 1 the regular closing hours of the city parks do not apply to persons having permission from the city to be present in the city parks during closed hours on specific days and for specific purposes 2 the regular closing hours of the city parks apply to persons in attendance at a regularly scheduled ball game at any city ball diamond the omro area athletic association ballpark shall be vacated closed and the field lights turned off by  midnight all play must be suspended and no innings shall commence after  pm 3 the regular closing hours of the city parks do not apply to persons launching fishing boats or watercraft for other waterrelated activities 4 the regular closing hours of the city parks do not apply to persons actively fishing and their designated vehicle thereof c emergency park closing and opening the chief of police parks committee or common council will have full authority to open and close any park facility or area because of weather condition physical condition conduction of a city function or related event construction or when in the interest of public safety it is deemed necessary prior     part 2003 reservation of park space a policy on reservation 1 general policy cityowned park and park facilities and shelter areas are primarily for the nonexclusive use of the residents and visitors of the city however under proper circumstances exclusive use of the same or parts thereof may be permitted this section is intended to regulate exclusive use of municipallyowned parks park facilities park shelters or parts thereof 2 fees the fees for reservations shall be as established by the common council upon the recommendation of the parks committee the common council upon recommendation of the parks committee may waive all permit fees for exclusive usage of parks facilities b reservation of park space a responsible person age 18 or over or group firm organization partnership or corporation may reserve the use of a park facility or a park shelter by written application filed with the office of the city administrator for a permit for exclusive use of the same the office of the city administrator shall issue permits for exclusive use of a portion of a park park shelter or park facility while the omro common council shall issue permits for the exclusive use of an entire city park all reservations shall be made on application forms in the office of the city administrator and shall be on a firstcome firstserved basis  provided however that any citybased community or civic group may make reservations for dates used by it in past years on a continuing basis at any time reservation of a designated area shall give the party to whom reserved the right to use such area to the exclusion of others for and during the period of reservation areas not reserved shall be open to use by all c application applications shall be filed at least 30 days prior to the date on which the exclusive use of the entire park is requested or at least three days prior to the date on which a park shelter park facility aquatic center or any portion of a park is to be used and shall set forth the following information regarding the proposed exclusive use 1 the name address and telephone number of the applicant  2 if the exclusive use is proposed for a group firm organization partnership or corporation the name address and telephone number of the headquarters of the same and the responsible and authorized heads or partners of the same  3 the name address and telephone number of the person who will be responsible for the use of the park area or facility  4 the date when the exclusive use is requested and the hours of the proposed exclusive date  5 the anticipated number of persons to use the park area or facility  6 any additional information which the director of community services or city administrators office finds reasonably necessary to determine whether a permit shall be issued  and 7 receipt of a nonrefundable fee and a refundable security deposit along with a signed permit application d action on application the office of the city administrator shall act promptly on all applications for permits for exclusive park use after consulting with the applicant if necessary e reasons for denial applicants under this section may be denied for any of the following reasons 1 if it is for a use which would involve a violation of federal or state law or any provision of this   2 if the granting of the permit would conflict with another permit already granted or for which application is already pending  3 if the application does not contain the information required by of this section  4 if the application is made less than the required days in advance of the scheduled exclusive use  5 if it is for a use of the park or park facility at a date and time when in addition to the proposed use anticipated exclusive use by others of the park or park facility is expected and would be seriously adversely affected  6 if the law enforcement requirements of the exclusive use will require so large a number of persons as to prevent adequate law enforcement to the park park facility or shelter area involved or of the rest of the city  or 7 if the exclusive use will reasonably create a substantial risk of injury to persons or damage to property f indemnification prior to granting any permit for exclusive use of the park the city may require the permittee to file evidence of good and sufficient sureties insurance in force or other evidence of adequate financial responsibility running to the city and such other third parties as may be injured or damaged in an amount depending upon the likelihood of injury or damage as a direct and proximate result of the exclusive use sufficient to indemnify the city and such third parties as may be injured or damaged thereby caused by the permittee its agents or participants g permit not required for city activity a permit is not required for exclusive use of the park or a park facility sponsored by the city h permit revocation the chief of police may revoke a permit already issued if it is deemed that such action is justified by an actual or potential emergency due to weather fire riot other catastrophe or likelihood of a breach of the peace or by a major change in the conditions forming the basis of the issuance of the permit i reserved permit cancellation the permit fee for the exclusive use of park facilities will not be refunded if a cancellation occurs the security deposit portion when required may be returned if the park facility is not used or is vacated in the proper state of cleanliness and no damage to property has occurred the director of community services or designee thereof shall decide when the security deposit will be retained and for what specific reason mooring fees collected for reserved sites are nonrefundable if a cancellation occurs j form of permit each permit shall be in a form prescribed by the city and shall designate the park park facility or shelter area involved date hours of the exclusive use purpose of the exclusive use and the name of the person group firm organization partnership or corporation to which the permit is issued k class b fermented malt beverage licenses when fermented malt beverages are sold at any event authorized by this section a valid temporary class b fermented malt beverage license andor temporary class b wine license must be obtained from the city of omro the licenses shall be obtained according to the provisions of must be in full compliance of the same wis stats  125266 the person who filed the original license must hold the license application and shall be posted at the site and presented to any law enforcement officer upon request all applicable license fees and any corresponding administration fees necessary for conducting the required background checks must be received prior to issuance of any temporary alcoholic beverage license l care of facilities persons reserving city facilities shall be completely responsible for cleaning up the facilities after the event to the satisfaction of the director of community services or designee thereof all reserved areas shall be left in a clean condition with refuse placed in containers provided for such purpose failure to leave facility in clean condition will result in forfeiture of security deposit any organization or corporation reserving any area in a city park shall agree to assume full responsibility for all damage to city property by any invitee of such organization or corporation and shall make full payment therefore upon billing by the city administrator failure to do so shall deny future use of park facilities until such payment be made in addition to any other remedy which the city may have prior     part 2003 foot bridge over fox river at webster avenue a use restricted no person shall stand or loiter on the walkway or footbridge in any manner as to impede the regular flow of pedestrian traffic or to gather on the walkway or footbridge in any manner that may be construed as a public nuisance no fishing is allowed off of any portion of the footbridge at any time b vehicles prohibited no person shall operate a bicycle sled snowmobile motorcycle or any other motor vehicle except those motorized vehicles specifically designed for the use of a handicapped person over upon or across the walkway or footbridge over the fox river motorized vehicles specifically designed for the transport of a handicapped person shall be allowed c use of abutments prohibited no person shall stand upon loiter or walk upon any abutment or railing appertaining to the walkway or footbridge over the fox river d preservation of good order any police officer may give an order for the preservation of good order and the equal convenience of the public on or near the walkway or footbridge over the fox river and any person refusing or neglecting to obey such order shall be subject to immediate arrest and to the penalty provided in prior     part 2003 chapter 1226  waterways  boats and water safety footnotes  4  state law reference navigable waters harbors and navigation wis stats ch 30  boating wis stats  3050 et seq purpose and definition a purpose it is hereby declared that it is in the best interest of the visual aesthetics public health safety or welfare including the publics interest in preserving the states natural resources to enact an ordinance regulating boats and water safety on the waters within the jurisdiction of the city of omro and the abatement of public nuisances arising from such b definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning 1 abandoned boat means any boat left unattended andor dilapidated on any and all waters within the legal boundary limits of the city for more than 21 consecutive days 2 boat means every description of watercraft used or capable of being used as a means of transportation on the water except a seaplane or a fishing raft 3 boat house means a structure designed exclusively for the storage of boats which do not contain any furniture and furnishings and which is not at any time used for human habitation and which is anchored or fixed to any of the shorelines within the limits of the city 4 dilapidated means in disrepair unseaworthy partly ruined or decayed especially as a result of neglect or maintenance 5 house boat means a structure designed and arranged to be used for human occupancy or habitation which is without propulsion of any kind or which is anchored or fixed to any of the shorelines within the limits of the city 6 navigable means passable by ship or boat especially deep enough and wide enough to allow ships or boats to sail navigable water means any waters within the territorial limits of the city of omro 8 pier means any structure extending into the water from the shore with water on both sides built or maintained for the purpose of providing a berth for watercraft or for loading or unloading cargo or passengers onto or from watercraft 9 slownowake means that speed at which a boat moves as slowly as possible while still maintaining steerage control 10 unattended means not having anyone present to oversee or participate in regularly scheduled maintenance of the boat in a fully functioning manner as when produced originally from the manufacturer so that the boat does not become inoperable neglected to the state of disrepair or not being seaworthy this includes but is not limited to abandonment dilapidation and not legally licensed to operate on the waters of the state 11 watercraft means any transportation device used or designed for navigation on water    state statutes adopted the city of omro does hereby adopt by reference the provisions of wis stats ch 30 as amended excluding therefrom the penalty or punishment provisions for said statutes as if said statutes were fully set out herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any state law incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this chapter    penalties and enforcement authorization a penalties except as otherwise provided in this chapter violations of this chapter are a class c offense any person violating this chapter including those provisions of the wisconsin statutes incorporated herein by reference shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $20000 and not more than $5000000 and the cost of prosecution and in default of payment of such forfeiture and the cost of prosecution may be imprisoned in the county jail unless otherwise authorized by law until payment of such forfeiture and the cost of prosecution b the following persons are hereby authorized to enforce the provisions of this chapter and may issue citations as provided for in wis stats  800022 for violations of this chapter 1 the chief of police or designee thereof 2 the zoning administrator 3 such other city officers or city employees who are assigned enforcement responsibilities for this chapter    waterway markers and regulatory signage regulation a general the common council finds that regulating the placement and maintenance of regulatory waterway markers and signage is in the best interest of the general public health welfare and public safety therefore the city of omro and winnebago county find it necessary to regulate the administration of waterway markers and signage pursuant to wis stats  30773a within the waters of the fox river and other navigable waters within the jurisdiction of the city of omro b navigational markers the placement of regulatory waterway markers and signage shall first be approved by the common council and the wisconsin dnr waterway marker permit pursuant to wis admin nr 509 c delegation of authority the common council does hereby delegate the authority for the administration of this section the citys department of public works or designee thereof shall install the waterway markers and navigational buoys in the fox river channel no later than may 1 with safe conditions permitting and retrieve the waterway markers and navigational buoys no earlier than october 15 with safe conditions permitting the waterway navigational control buoys shall be placed so that nautical traffic is alerted to the nowake speed areas so designated d annual inspection and local permit required the annual fee for a local waterway navigational marker permit issued by the city of omro shall be as established by resolution waterway markers and signage owned and placed by the city of omro or winnebago county are exempt from this annual fee and permit process by march 31 of each calendar year the riparian property owner shall obtain an annual permit from the city of omro prior to installation of navigational waterway markers which have been approved in accordance with wis admin nr 509 the department of public works or designee thereof shall cause to be removed any and all waterway markers and signs that are not permitted properly placed and maintained or do not conform with wis admin nr 509    water skiing and swimming restricted areas a water skiing no person shall operate a motorboat towing a person on water skis innertube tubing an aquaplane or any similar device on the fox river within the corporate city limits  nor shall any boat operator allow persons to swim from or engage in water skiing aquaplaning or a similar activity on the waters of the fox river within the corporate city limits b swimming limitations in accordance with no person shall swim bathe or wade in any of the waters of the fox river or its associated channels and tributaries within the city limits this includes but is not limited to either swimming or bathing in the waters of the lagoons at scott park or miller park or swimming in the fox river from the shores off any cityowned property    operation of motorboats a applicability and enforcement the provisions of this section shall apply to the waters of the fox river b intent it is the intent of this section is to provide safe and healthful conditions for the enjoyment of aquatic recreation consistent with public right and interests and the capability of the water resources c controlled area no person shall operate a boat faster than slownowake at all times on the waters of the fox river beginning at the west corporate city limits and ending at the east corporate city limits d posting requirement the city of omro shall place and maintain a synopsis of this chapter at all public fox river access points within the jurisdiction of the city of omro pursuant to the requirements of wis admin 15 no person shall operate a motorboat at a speed in excess of the posted notice as established by public launch site signage and regulatory nowake buoys or markers installed at locations within the waters of the fox river within the city limits e penalties wisconsin state boating penalties as found in wis stats  3080 and deposits established in the uniform deposit and bail schedule established by the wisconsin judicial conference are adopted by reference and all references to fines amended to forfeitures and all references to imprisonment deleted f special restrictions on towing recreational devices no person shall operate a motorboat towing a person on water skis innertube tubing an aquaplane or any similar device on the fox river within the corporate city limits  nor shall any boat operator allow persons to swim from or engage in water skiing aquaplaning or a similar activity on the waters of the fox river within the corporate city limits b   dock and pier facilities a private property all installation of piers docks wharves and seawall on private property shoreline shall be permitted constructed maintained and removed in accordance with wis stats ch 30 navigable waters harbors and navigation filing a copy of the permit with the city is required b public property all construction and maintenance of piers docks wharves seawall boardwalks and bridges built on pilings shall be in accordance with wis stats ch 30 navigable waters harbors and navigation 1 no person shall use the citys dock facilities for loading or unloading of boats vessels or mooring for commercial purposes without the written consent of the common council or designated city officer 2 cleanliness of docks persons utilizing the citys dock facilities shall at all times keep the docks walls and premises adjacent to such dock facility in a neat and orderly manner free from trash rubbish repair parts machinery equipment and debris of all kinds unless otherwise authorized by the common council or designated city officer    boat mooring no boats or other watercraft should be moored to any city property for a period of more than 12 hours or overnight without the approval of the public works director or hisher designee except those boats or watercraft holding a valid mooring permit for designated overnight mooring areas no boat or watercraft shall moor in designated overnight mooring facilities at any time unless a valid permit is taken out no boat or watercraft shall utilize any electrical or water utilities for any length of time unless a valid permit is issued the overnight mooring permit shall apply to the original watercraft designated on the permit application no permit may be transferred to another watercraft for use of overnight mooring or mooring at any other time in a designated overnight facility site in the event that a watercraft with time remaining on a valid permit vacates a mooring site then the permit may not be used by any other watercraft than the original watercraft to which the permit was issued any additional watercraft dockingtying up to a permitted watercraft in designated overnight mooring facility sites must also acquire a valid permit no stacking of boats will be permitted without obtaining a valid overnight mooring permit and paying the applicable fee overnight mooring facility users and other mooring facility users will be subject to the provisions and regulations set forth in a payment of fees overnight mooring permit fees shall be paid on a daily basis for the designated facilities and all requested permit application information and corresponding fees must be deposited into the proper collection receptacle provided at the mooring site the daily mooring fees shall be recommended by the parks committee and established by resolution of the city council reserved mooring permit fees shall be collected according to the provisions of b valid hours of permit the daily permit for overnight mooring in designated sites shall be valid from  pm on the date of purchase until  noon of the following day all watercraft mooring prior to the check in time or using utilities prior to the check in time must acquire a valid permit for that day and acquire an additional permit after  pm for the next nights stay all watercraft moored past  noon on the following day must either acquire an additional overnight mooring permit or vacate the mooring facility and discontinue usage of any utilities provided at the mooring site if another party has reserved a specific mooring site for the next night then the currently moored watercraft must relocate to another site by  noon c display of permit such permits shall be displayed on the mooring site post of the corresponding dock facility in use failure to display the permit in the proper designated area may result in the issuance of a violation citation d exemptions exemption from payment of the watercraft mooring fees may be granted for mooring of certain authorized government watercraft or fire department water rescue vehicles by the express approval of the chief of police or the director of community services or designees thereof e avoidance of fees no person or owner of a watercraft vehicle shall engage in any shift scheme device or plan which results in payment of less than the actual permit fee due for any person mooring a watercraft vehicle at a city mooring facility violation of this section is considered absconding and will be issued an ordinance violation citation and applicable fines from the omro police department f responsibility of owner if any watercraft vehicle violates any section of this the operator of the vehicle cannot be determined then the owner or person in whose name such vehicle is registered is held prima facie responsible for such violation g penalties the penalty for violation of any provision of this section and related resolutions or sections shall be a forfeiture of moneys for fines and court assessments as established by the omro police department under the authority of the state of wisconsin h enforcement 1 the enforcement of this section shall fall under the jurisdiction of the omro police department for the purpose of enforcing this section the director of community services or designees thereof shall summons the omro police department to issue citations for violation of this section 2 issuance of tickets law enforcement officers observing violations of the restrictions specified within this section may issue citations or tickets which shall be attached to the vehicle in violation each ticket shall specify the violation of this section the location of the vehicle in violation the license or registration number of the vehicle in violation the state of registration of the vehicle in violation the time of violation of the provisions of this section and any other facts or knowledge of which is necessary to an understanding of the circumstances attending to the violation of this section i alternate procedure in lieu of the foregoing provisions a person who has been issued a citation for violation of this section may request a hearing regarding such violation the person shall be issued a citation or summons and such proceedings shall thereafter be governed by wis stats  3453434547 j revenue all revenues derived from mooring fees shall be designated within the general fund and used strictly to fund operational expenses for the mooring facilities and repairs of mooring facilities upon the guidance and authorization of the director of public works use of these designated revenue funds for repairs capital improvements to the mooring facilities or to other water based park facilities will require the recommendation of the parks committee and approval of the omro common council use of these designated revenue funds for any other park capital improvements or repairs will require the recommendation of the parks committee and approval of the omro common council all unused revenues at the end of the calendar year will automatically roll over into the next years budget for parks capital improvements upon the final authorization of the omro city council and shall continue to be designated and used strictly for expenses in such a manner as designated above    boatwatercraft launch permit a permit required no person shall launch a boat or other watercraft or otherwise utilize any of the designated municipalowned and operated watercraft launch sites nor shall any person park a boat trailer or other vehicle in the parking stalls located near the boat launch sites that have been designated specifically for vehicles with boat trailers without having obtained the appropriate permit or sticker paid the established fee followed the procedures set forth on the application for such permit or sticker and properly affixed the permit or sticker to the parked vehicle or trailer any vehicle parked in the parking stalls near the boat launch sites designated for vehicles with boat trailers only shall have a permit or sticker for each and every day it is so parked a oneday permit shall be in effect until  midnight on the date the permit was purchased the permit shall apply only for the use of launching one watercraft 1 establishment of boatwatercraft launching fees launching fees shall be recommended by the parks committee and established by resolution of the omro common council the established fees will be kept on file in the office of the city administrator 2 payment of launching fees permit fees shall be paid on a daily or annual basis for the use of all cityowned and operated launching facilities all requested daily permit application information and corresponding fees must be deposited into the proper collection receptacle provided at the launching sites annual permits may be obtained at omro city hall upon completion of the permit application form and receipt of the applicable fee a second annual permit for the same owner of record of additional watercraft may be obtained for an additional minimal fee 3 daily permits daily permits shall only be valid during the day of purchase such permits shall be displayed in the drivers side window of the motor vehicle used to launch the watercraft and shall remain on display for the entire time the vehicle is on the premises of the city launch site or until the watercraft is removed from the river if not parked on the premises of the city launch site 4 annual permits annual permits shall be valid from march 1 of the issuing year to the last day of february of the subsequent year annual permit stickers shall be prominently displayed on the lefthand side of the trailer used to transport the watercraft to the launch site if no trailer is used the annual permit stickers should be placed on the back left bumper of the vehicle used to transport the watercraft to the launch site 5 exemptions exemption from payment of the watercraft launching fees may be granted for launching of certain authorized government watercraft or fire department water rescue vehicles with the express approval of the chief of police or the director of public works or designees thereof b avoidance of fees no person or owner of a watercraft vehicle shall engage in any shift scheme device or plan which results in payment of less than the actual permit fee due for any person launching a watercraft vehicle at a cityowned and operated watercraft launch facility violation of this subsection shall result in the issuance of a ticket andor citation and applicable fines from the omro police department c responsibility of owner if any watercraft vehicle violates any section of this the operator of the vehicle cannot be determined then the owner or person in whose name such transport vehicle or trailer is registered is held prima facie responsible for such violation d penalties the penalty for violation of any provision of this section and related resolutions or sections shall be a forfeiture of moneys for fines and court assessments as established by the omro police department under the authority of the state of wisconsin e enforcement 1 the enforcement of this section shall fall under the jurisdiction of the omro police department for the purpose of enforcing this section the director of public works or designees thereof shall summons the omro police department to issue citations for violation of this section 2 issuance of tickets law enforcement officers observing violations of the restrictions specified within this section may issue citations or tickets which shall be attached to the vehicle in violation each ticket shall specify the violation of this section the location of the vehicle in violation the license or registration number of the vehicle in violation the state of registration of the vehicle in violation the time of violation of the provisions of this section and any other facts or knowledge of which is necessary to an understanding of the circumstances attending to the violation of this section f alternate procedure in lieu of the foregoing provisions a person who has been issued a citation for violation of this section may request a hearing regarding such violation the person shall be issued a citation or summons and such proceedings shall thereafter be governed by wis stats  3453434547 g revenue all revenues derived from launch fees shall be designated within the general fund and used strictly to fund operational expenses for the launch site facilities and repairs to boat launch facilities upon the guidance and authorization of the director of community services use of these designated revenue funds for repairs or capital improvements to the boat launch sites other water based facilities will require the recommendation of the parks committee and approval of the omro common council use of these designated revenue funds for any other parks capital improvements or repairs will require the recommendation of the parks committee and the approval of the omro common council all unused boat launch revenues at the end of the calendar year will automatically roll over into the next years budget for parks capital improvements upon the final authorization of the omro city council and shall continue to be designated and used strictly for such expenses as described above    house boats a adoption of state statutes the governance of house boats within the jurisdiction of the city of omro is pursuant wis stats   the city of omro does hereby adopt by reference the provisions of wis stats   as if said statutes were fully set out herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any state law incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this section b flotation required each and every house boat in use will be required to use flotation methods and devices of a type constructed of polyurethane highimpact polyethylene fiberglass material wood timbers or other inert materials to provide flotation the use of any iron or steel containers not fabricated originally for flotation purposes including barrels tanks and other containers originally constructed for the purpose of containing fluids powders or similar products is prohibited for new structure or for replacement of flotation devices in existing structures unless filled with polyurethane c sanitary facilities  all houseboats shall be required to have installed and in working order such sanitary facilities as are required by wis admin sps 386 which chapter is hereby incorporated herein by reference d use of shoreline abutting public lands after the effective date of the ordinance from which this section is derived no officer or agency of the city shall authorize the mooring anchoring or fixing of any house boats along the shoreline on any of the water abutting the land owned by the city of omro e house boat regulations 1 they shall display proper name of vessel and maintain current registration with the state of wisconsin 2 whether on water or on land they shall be securely anchored 3 they shall be maintained in a good and sanitary condition and shall be periodically painted so as to avoid unsightly appearance 4 the approach to them shall be safe and well maintained and adjacent lands shall be kept clean and sanitary and free from debris 5 each shall contain a minimum of one approved coast guard life preserver and one fire extinguisher 6 they shall be subject to inspection by appropriate officers of the city to ensure compliance with all of the terms and conditions of this section 7 they shall be held in place or in a stable position with spuds andor cables 8 they shall be outfitted with the flotation device required by of this section and the sanitary facilities required by of this section 9 house boats found abandoned or in a dilapidated condition will be removed by the city of omro at the owners expense 10 any house boat which breaks loose from its moorings may be demolished by the city  provided however if possible it shall be salvaged but all expenses of salvage and demolition shall be charged to the owner thereof f violation of regulations the owner of a house boat or boathouse violating any of the terms and conditions of this section or any resolution enacted pursuant thereto or if the facility is maintained in a dilapidated or otherwise unsanitary condition the city of omro may in addition to the other penalties provided in this section terminate allowance of the house boat to be moored within the waters of the city of omro    abandoned andor dilapidated boats a statutory authorization this section is adopted pursuant to wis stats  30773 it is hereby declared that it is in the best interest of the public health safety or welfare including the publics interest in preserving the states natural resources to enact an ordinance regulating abandoned boats in waters within the jurisdiction of the city of omro the presence of abandoned andor dilapidated boats on the fox river and other waters in the city of omro can cause a safety hazard if such vessels are unattended b abandonment prohibited no person shall leave unattended any boat on any water navigable waters or within the ordinary highwater mark of the navigable water for such time and under such circumstance to cause the boat to be an abandoned boat this includes boats tied moored anchored or by any means secured to the shore of private property c public nuisance declared an abandoned boat hereby constitutes a public nuisance d abatementremoval abatementremoval of boats declared public nuisances shall be done by the property owner within the time allocated on the issued citation e reasonable access any owner of property where an abandoned boat is located shall allow reasonable access to the owners property to inspect and remove the boat f remedies 1 penalties the person who abandoned the boat or the last registered owner of the abandoned boat shall be subject to a forfeiture of not less than $20000 for the first offense and shall forfeit not less than $40000 for any second or subsequent offense within a fiveyear period each day a violation occurs shall constitute a separate offense the last registered owner shall have an affirmative defense to the citation if said owner can establish that said owner sold the boat prior to the date of the offense g removal the person subject to a penalty under this section shall be responsible for removal storage and proper disposal of the abandoned andor dilapidated boat in addition to the forfeiture imposed a court of competent jurisdiction shall have authority to order such removal storage andor disposal of the abandoned boat by the offender to abate the public nuisance public nuisance boats may be abated by the city and all costs associated with such abatement may be charged as a service fee against the property owner unpaid service fees may be placed as a special assessment charge on the tax roll    contamination of waterways a it is unlawful for any person to throw discharge or otherwise place or cause to be placed in the water of any fountain pond lake stream river or other body of water or on the ice thereof in or adjacent to any park any substance matter or thing liquid or solid which will or may result in pollution of such waters as defined by the department of natural resources b adoption of state statutes on littering the city of omro does hereby adopt by reference the provisions of wis stats  287812 as amended as if said statutes were fully set out herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any state law incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this chapter    chapter 1228  city cemetery policy statement a state statutes adopted wis stats ch 157 is adopted by reference and made a part of this section insofar as such chapter is applicable b cemetery name the name of the cemetery shall be the omro cemetery c purpose the omro cemetery is owned and maintained by the city for the benefit of all citizens the following rules and regulations are set forth in this chapter to govern the cemetery the city reserves the right to amend or change any of these sections to conform with newly developed cemetery practices prior    administration a interments all graves shall be opened and closed under the direct supervision and approval of the cemetery operator which may collect charges for excavation and closing all charges shall be paid in full prior to interment the common council shall determine such charges which shall be kept as a part of the fee schedule on file in the office of the city clerk b regulations the common council may make such regulations for management and care of the cemetery that it deems proper and necessary prior    ownership rights of interment a 1 the lot owner or hisher authorized agent shall have the right to use a lot or portion of a lot for burial purposes only in accordance with the terms of the cemetery rules and regulations 2 upon full payment of the purchase price of a lot the city clerk will issue a cemetery deed and the deed will be recorded in the records of the city as evidence of ownership of the lot or fractions of lots for which lot deeds have been issued by the city will not thereafter be divided except by consent of the city all lots are exempt from taxation and cannot be seized for debt except those owed to the cemetery nor can they be mortgaged 3 all repossessed vacant grave spaces shall be subject to the same fees and charges 4 the lot owner shall have acquired the lot for interment of himself and members of hisher family however the lot owner may grant written permission which must be notarized and placed on file with the city administrator for the burial of other persons no corpse shall be interred in a lot except the corpse of one having an interest therein or a relative or the husband or wife of such person or hisher relative except by the consent of all persons having an interest in the lot b unless otherwise directed in writing and filed with the city clerk the lot owner hisher devisees or hisher heirs the cemetery will permit the interment of members of hisher family at the request of any interested person upon proof of eligibility for burial as follows 1 the surviving spouse of the lot owner shall have the first right to interment or to direct the right of interment 2 when there is no surviving spouse the devisees or heirs of the owners may by agreement in writing determine who among them shall have the right of interment or direction for interment which agreement shall be filed with the city clerk 3 in the event the owner hisher devisees or heirs shall not have arranged for future interments then the devisees or the heirs as the case may be of such owner shall have the right to interment in order of their need c all burial rights in cemetery lots purchased from the city occupy the same position as real estate at the death of the owner only such persons whose names appear on the cemetery records of the city will be recognized as owners or part owners of lots in case of the death of a lot owner when the cemetery lot is disposed of by a will and when ownership is to be determined a certified copy of the will must be delivered to the city clerk before the city will recognize the change of ownership if the deceased lot owner left no will satisfactory proof of descent must be provided it is recommended that lot owners in making their wills include a provision covering the cemetery lots and devise same to one person d lot owners may not resell or transfer their lots or parts of lots except as outlined below 1 the city clerk shall enter in the record kept for that purpose all deeds of transfer and reconveyance of cemetery lots no such reconveyance shall be received and recorded by the city administrator until a conveyance fee has been paid therefor the fee shall go into the general municipal fund 2 reconveyance of lots or parts of lots may be made only by written application therefor upon blanks furnished by the city administrator the same to be approved by the cemetery operator such application shall be executed by the owner of the lots or if the owner is deceased by the legal heirs the application shall state the lot and block number 3 no owner of a cemetery lot shall sell transfer or assign the same or the unused portion thereof to any other person without the cemetery operators consent the common council shall have the right of first refusal to repurchase such lot or part thereof at the current grave price if the owner of any lot or part of a lot should sell or transfer the same without giving notice to the cemetery committee except of such transaction such sale or transfer shall be null and void e whenever possible repossessed lots will be used for burials before new areas of the cemetery are used or platted prior    privileges and restrictions a no mound shall be raised upon any grave above the general level of the lot b no hedges fences or enclosures of any kind will be permitted on or around lots wooden boxes wire containers glass jars bottles toys cans and other such objects may not be placed on lots and if so placed will be removed by the cemetery committee without notice urns are not permitted on lots sold after the passage of this chapter existing urns shall be removed by the cemetery committee as they become unsightly or deteriorated and shall not be replaced however before any such urn is destroyed or discarded the last owner of record of the lot shall be notified by registered or certified mail with return receipt requested that such urn has been removed from the grave and will be destroyed unless the owner thereof claims same within 30 days after mailing of such letter c no trees will be permitted on any lots d all artificial flowers displayed in the cemetery must be in containers and placed at the head of the grave lot on the marker foundation any artificial flowers not in containers will be removed from the cemetery by the sexton e wreaths on wire stands must also be placed at the head of the lot in the headstone row f fresh cut flowers may be used anytime and will remain until in the judgment of the sexton they become wilted or unsightly containers for cut flowers are to be a type level with the ground surface and not holding water when not in use or of the type to be disposed of when the flowers are removed g potted plants may be set on lots without disturbing the sod on special occasions such as memorial day birthday anniversary etc but will be picked up and destroyed if unsightly or preserved for use in the cemetery beds if suitable h all landscaping care of lots and other work in the cemetery will be done by the city but it is desired that each lot owner feel free to consult with those in charge of the cemetery at all times their advice will be cheerfully given without charge and may be of much value to those contemplating the purchase of or improvements to cemetery lots the city shall retain the ownership of all aisles including monument aisles i the city reserves the right for its personnel and those persons necessary to the performance of normal cemetery operation to enter upon or cross over any lot in the cemetery in the performance of such duties j the city or its employees assumes no liability for damages to property or of persons or for physical or mental suffering arising out of the performance of its normal operations or for loss by vandalism or other acts beyond its reasonable control k the city reserves the right to alter change or close alleys roadways water mains and other physical public properties of the cemetery prior    rules for visitors a purpose and definition in order to protect cemetery areas within the city from injury damage or desecration these regulations are enacted the term cemetery as hereinafter used in this section shall include all cemetery property grounds equipment and structures both privately and publicly owned which are located within the city b authority to establish rules and regulations the cemetery property owner shall have the authority to establish reasonable rules and
