roof drain cistern overflow sump pump area drain surface drain cooling waterline or any other type of drainline that would allow surface water groundwater rainwater or any other type of unpolluted water to enter the wastewater collection system existing prohibited clear water connections must be removed from the building sewer before connection to the wastewater collection system any person in violation of this requirement shall be subject to immediate imposition of a fine as set forth in this section and shall disconnect all sources of clear water from the wastewater collection sewer system within 30 days from the date of written notice by the city if any person fails to comply after the expiration of the time provided the city may cause disconnection to be made and charge the costs thereof as a special charge against the property the costs of disconnection shall be charged in addition to any fines imposed for violation of this section a fine of $10000 per day shall be imposed upon any person in violation of this section all costs of prosecution shall be added to all fines imposed   part 2006 user charge system a policy it shall be the policy of the city council to obtain sufficient revenues to pay the debt service costs and the costs of the operation maintenance and equipment replacement of the wastewater treatment and collection system system of sewer service charges as defined in this chapter the system shall ensure that each user of the system pays a proportionate share of the cost of such facilities b assignment of sewer users the city will assign sewer users into appropriate sewer service charge categories if wastewater sampling programs and other related information indicate a change of categories is necessary c user charge methodology the following methodology shall be used to calculate the debt service and operation maintenance and repair om&r charges for the collection and treatment of city wastewater 1 quarterly fixed charge the quarterly fixed charge is a charge imposed upon all connections to the system the fixed charge shall be established by the city and applied to all users this cost is based entirely on meter size and is independent of wastewater flow the fixed charge shall be applied to debt service with any remaining amounts applied to the operating costs of the city until such time that the city project financing is paid and the fixed charge can be deleted 2 quarterly variable om&r charge the quarterly variable om&r charge shall be paid by all users based on the cost per 1000 gallons of flow the total annual costs are divided by the total annual loadings to obtain the unit cost per billing parameter   part 2006 septic tank and holding tank waste a septic tanks and holding tanks prohibited the maintenance and use of septic tanks holding tanks or other private disposal systems within the sewer service area of the city serviced by its wastewater collection system are declared a public nuisance and a health hazard the use of these systems is prohibited unless a special permit is obtained from the city upon abandonment of the septic tank or holding tank the tank shall be filled with sand or gravel in a manner acceptable to the city b septic tank and holding tank disposal no person in the business of gathering and disposing of septic tank or holding tank wastes shall transfer such material into any disposal area or manhole located within the city boundaries unless a permit for disposal has been first obtained from the city written application for this permit shall be made to the city and shall state the name and address of the applicant  the number of its disposal units  and the make model and license number of each unit permits shall be nontransferable except in case of replacement of the disposal unit for which a permit shall have been originally issued the permit may be obtained upon payment of a fee the city shall establish annual fees any applicant for a permit shall furnish a bond to the city in the amount of $500000 to guarantee performance the bond shall be provided prior to the permit being issued the city will designate the time and place of disposal the city may impose such conditions as it deems necessary on any permit granted bills shall be mailed on a monthly basis and if payments are not received in 30 days thereof disposal privileges shall be suspended 1 any commercial hauler of septic tank or holding tank wastes agrees to carry public liability insurance in an amount not less than $10000000 and to protect all persons or property from injury andor damage caused in any way or manner by any act or failure to act by any of hisher employees a certificate certifying such insurance to be in full force and effect shall be furnished to the city 2 any wastes discharged into the wastewater treatment system shall be of domestic origin and will comply with the provisions of all applicable ordinances of the city a discharger shall not deposit or drain any gasoline oil acid alkali grease rags waste volatile or inflammable liquids or other deleterious substances into any manhole nor allow any earth sand or solid material to pass into any part of the wastewater system 3 any person or party disposing of septic tank or holding tank wastes agrees to indemnify and save harmless the city of omro from all liability and claims for damage arising out of or resulting from work and labor performed   part 2006 industrial and septage wastes prohibited a industrial discharges the discharge of any waters or wastes which waters wastes or septage contain substances or possess the characteristics enumerated in may have deleterious effects upon the wastewater treatment facility processes equipment or receiving waters or which otherwise create a hazard to life health or constitute a public nuisance are prohibited to be discharged to the city sanitary sewer system b grease andor sand interceptors the city has the authority to require grease oil and sand interceptors when deemed necessary grease oil and sand interceptors shall be provided by the discharger and shall be located as to be readily and easily accessible for cleaning and inspection in the maintaining of these interceptors the discharger shall be responsible for the proper removal and disposal of the captured material and shall maintain records of the dates and means of disposal which are subject to review by the city properly licensed disposal firms must perform any removal and hauling of the collected materials not performed by the dischargers personnel c analyses 1 all measurements tests and analyses of the characteristics of a wastewater to which reference is made in this section shall be determined in accordance with standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater published by the american public health association and guidelines establishing test procedures for analysis of pollutants 197 40 cfr 136 sampling methods locations times durations and frequencies are to be determined on an individual basis subject to approval by the city 2 determination of the character and concentration of wastewater shall be made by the person discharging them or hisher agent as designated and required by the city the city may also make its own analyses of the wastes and these determinations shall be used as a basis for charges if the person discharging the waste contests the determination the city may elect to have an independent laboratory determine the character and concentration of the waste such independent laboratory shall be acceptable to both the city and the person discharging the waste the discharger shall assume all costs incurred by the independent laboratory in making the determination d submission of information plans specifications and any other pertinent information relating to any proposed pretreatment grease trap or sand interceptor shall be submitted for review of the city prior to the start of construction if the effluent from such facilities is to be discharged into the public sewers e submission of basic data commercial users desiring to make a new connection to a public sewer for discharging wastes shall prepare and file with the city a report that shall include actual or predicted data relating to the quantity and characteristics of the waste to be discharged f time schedule for a new hookup to the wastewater collection system which requires a grease trap or sand interceptor such grease trap or sand interceptor shall be installed by the owner and inspected and approved by the city prior to initiating wastewater flow to the city 1 for an existing discharger such grease trap or sand interceptor shall be installed by the owner and inspected and approved by the city within 90 days of notification of such requirement 2 when it can be demonstrated that circumstances exist which would create an unreasonable burden on the person proposing to discharge a waste to comply with the time schedule imposed in this section a request for extension of the time may be presented for consideration by the city council g cost the city shall have the authority to install any pretreatment system if the owner does not comply with these requirements within 90 days of notification and charge the owner for all costs incurred or at its option place this cost as a lien on the owners property taxes   part 2006 payment of charges a payment and penalty the sewer service charge shall be billed on a quarterly basis and shall be payable to the city not later than 40 days after the end of each period a penalty of three percent but not less than $050 shall be added to all bills not paid by the date fixed for final payment b delinquent charges all delinquent wastewater charges shall be a lien upon the property pursuant to wis stats  4 and shall be collected in the manner therein provided c disposition of revenue the amounts received from the collection of charges authorized by this section shall be credited to a sewer account which shall show all receipts and expenditures of the system charges collected for replacement expenses shall be credited to a segregated nonlapsing replacement account these funds are to be used exclusively for replacement when appropriated by the city the credits to the sewer account shall be available for the payment of the requirements for operation maintenance repairs and depreciation of the system consistent with wis admin 11 any surplus outside the purview of wis admin 11 in such account shall be available for the payment of principal and interest of bonds issued and outstanding or which may be issued to provide funds for the sanitary sewer system or part thereof and all or a part of the expenses for additions and improvements and other necessary disbursements or indebtedness and the city may resolve to pledge each surplus or any part thereof for any such purpose d excess revenues excess revenues collected for a user class will be applied to operation and maintenance costs or fixed costs attributable to that class for the next year e annual audit the city shall conduct an audit annually or as required by the applicable funding agency the purpose of audit shall be to maintain the proportionality between the users and user classes of the user charge system and to ensure that adequate revenues are available relative to increasing operation maintenance and replacement costs   part 2006 violations and penalties a damages no unauthorized person shall maliciously willfully or negligently break damage destroy uncover deface or tamper with any structure of pertinence or equipment which is a part of the system b written notice of violation any person partnership corporation or other business entity or any officer agent or employee thereof connected to the sanitary sewer system found to be violating a provision of this chapter shall be served by the city with a written notice stating the nature of the violation and providing a reasonable time not to exceed 30 calendar days for the satisfactory correction thereof the offender shall within the period of time stated in such notice permanently cease all violation 1 any licensed discharger discharging to a public sewer found to be violating a provision of this chapter may have their approval immediately revoked this revocation shall be done in writing and state the reason for revoking the approval c accidental discharge any person found to be responsible for accidentally allowing a deleterious discharge into the wastewater collection system which causes damage to the city treatment facility andor receiving body of water shall in addition to a fine pay the amount to cover damages both values to be established by the city d continued violations any person partnership or corporation or any officer agent or employee thereof who shall continue any violation beyond the aforesaid notice time limit provided shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $10000 per day of continued violation and the cost of prosecution as determined by the city in default of payment of such forfeiture and costs the costs shall be placed on the property tax to obtain payment each day in which any violation is continued beyond the aforesaid notice time limit shall be deemed a separate offense nothing in this chapter shall preclude the city from maintaining an appropriate action to prevent or remove a violation of any provisions of this chapter e liability to city for losses any person violating any provision of this chapter shall become liable to the city for any expense loss or damage occasioned by reason of such violation which the city may suffer as a result thereof f damage recovery the city shall have the right of recovery from all persons any expense incurred by the system for the repair or replacement of any part of the system damaged in any manner by any person by the performance of any work under their control or by any negligent acts g penalties any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this chapter or rules or regulations of the city or who shall connect a service pipe or discharge without first having obtained a permit therefore  or who shall violate any provisions of the wisconsin statutes wisconsin administrative or any other requirements which are incorporated by reference shall forfeit not less than $10000 per day for each day a violation occurs and any costs of prosecution this however shall not bar the city from enforcing the connection duties for mandatory hookup each day in which such violation continues shall be deemed a separate offense   part 2006 secs   reserved article ii  limitations on connections limitation on sewer and water connections outside of municipal boundaries a city policy against providing sewer and water outside of municipal boundaries  the citys long standing policy is to provide city services such as sewer and water only to city residents and to encourage property owners located outside of the city to annex to the city in order to access city services b limitation on obligation to serve outside of municipal boundaries  this article shall limit the citys provision of wastewater andor water service outside the citys municipal boundaries the city shall have no obligation to serve any property outside the corporate limits of the city with wastewater andor water except as provided in this article this article shall constitute a limitation on the citys obligation to provide water and water services outside its municipal boundaries as allowed under wis stats  3 c limited provision of wholesale wastewater treatment service to algoma sanitary district no 1  to the limited extent provided in article iii of this chapter the city will provide wastewater treatment service to algoma sanitary district no 1 the city does not undertake to provide service to algoma sanitary district no 1 beyond that provided by article iii of this chapter   822016  editors note  1 adopted aug 2 201 set out provisions intended for use as   for purposes of classification and at the editors discretion these provisions have been included as   secs   reserved article iii  terms and conditions applicable to the provision of wastewater treatment service to algoma sanitary district no 1 footnotes  3  editors note  2 adopted sept 20 201 set out provisions intended for use as   for purposes of classification and at the editors discretion these provisions have been included as art iii   wholesale wastewater treatment service to algoma sanitary district no 1 a eligibility for wholesale wastewater treatment service  to the limited extent provided in this article algoma sanitary district no 1 is authorized to discharge wastewater it collects in its wastewater collection system from eligible properties as defined in this article directly to the citys wastewater treatment facility the city will to the limited extent set forth in this article accept for treatment the wastewater collected by algoma sanitary district no 1 from eligible properties b definitions 1 district means for purposes of this article algoma sanitary district no 1 and its respective successors and assigns or such other public boards committees commissions or entities as shall succeed substantially to the right powers and duties of the district 2 eligible property means a property which meets all the following requirements a the property is located within the districts boundaries b the property is located within the eligible service area c the district has issued a permit authorizing the property to be connected to the districts wastewater collection system and has forwarded a copy of that permit to the city within 30 days of authorization d a plumber licensed by the state of wisconsin has installed all connections of the property to the districts wastewater collection system e the connections between the property and the districts wastewater collection system have been installed in accordance with all state and local regulations f the connections between the property and the districts wastewater collection system have been inspected and approved by the districts plumbing inspector g the district has provided the city with a copy of the districts inspection report prepared by the districts inspector verifying that the connections between the property and the districts wastewater collection system have been inspected and were made in accordance with all state and local regulations h each connection between the property and the districts wastewater collection system sewer has been installed within two years of sewer connection permit issuance i the district has paid the city the applicable connection fee for the eligible property j the wastewater generated from the property will not exceed normal domestic strength wastewater as defined by the citys code of ordinances k the property has not lost its eligible property status for one of the reasons provided in section  3 eligible service area means for purposes of this article all lands lying within the districts boundaries and in the omro sewer service area as approved by the east central regional planning commission except those lands lying within the area bounded by south line county road e  west line 2nd avenue extending the boundary straight north along broderick road to liberty school road  north line liberty school road extending the boundary straight east to rivermoor road  and east line the western rightofway line of rivermoor road south to highway 21 east along highway 21 to scott street then straight south to county road e notwithstanding the foregoing the following specific parcels shall be included in the eligible service area i all parcels located on vande street clark street and cleve street  ii parcels 016023402 and 016023403 located on youngs road  iii the omro town hall parcel located at 4205 rivermoor road consisting of a 111 acre parcel identified as parcel 0160267  and iv the parcels located at 171 173 174 176 178 193 2104 and 2148 springbrook road and 1132 willow street all of which were connected prior to  c service to eligible properties  the district is not authorized to deliver wastewater from a potentially eligible property to the citys wastewater treatment plant until the district provides the city a copy of the districts inspection report along with the connection fee due for the eligible property d limitation on service  the city expressly declines to provide the district wastewater treatment service for the area excluded from the definition of eligible service area the city is expressly reserving this excluded area for future annexation by the city   2 9202016 volumetric discharge limit the district shall have no right to discharge to the citys wastewater treatment plant more than 607760 gallons of wastewater per day averaged over a onemonth period   2 9202016 connection fees a amount of connection fee the city shall charge the district a connection fee for each eligible property connected to the districts wastewater collection system the connection fee charged to the district for an eligible property shall be the same as the connection fee charged for a similar property located within the city the district shall be charged one connection fee for a single family residence and two or more connection fees for duplexes and larger structures the amount of the citys connection fee per hookup shall be as provided in a fee schedule approved by the omro common council b failure to pay a violation the districts failure to pay a connection fee for an eligible property is a violation of this article and could trigger fines andor disconnection as provided in section    2 9202016 wholesale wastewater treatment rates and charges  billing a rates established by common council the city will charge the district for wastewater treatment services as provided in this section the rates charged to the district shall be established by the common council as shown in the city fee schedule which may be amended from time to time the city uses cash basis accounting that does not include depreciation expense in the revenue requirement when establishing new rates the rates will be computed using projected expenses for a forward looking test year one year in the future and flow data and equivalent meter data for the most recently completed year will be used b fixed charge the city shall charge the district a fixed charge to recover the districts share of the citys fixed asset costs other than those fixed asset costs related to the citys wastewater collection system 1 the citys fixed charge shall be comprised of debt service debt service coverage at a rate of 125 times lending requirements and equipment replacement funds 2 the fixed asset costs do not change based on volume of wastewater conveyed to the treatment plant therefore the fixed charge is allocated to customers based on connections and meter equivalents 3 the districts share of fixed asset costs other than those fixed asset costs related to the citys wastewater collection system is based on the number of connections to the districts system 4 all fixed charges collected from the district shall be used for the equipment replacement fund debt service or debt service reserves for capital improvements to the citys wastewater system other than the citys collection system or placed in a reserve replacement or depreciation fund to be used for future capital improvements to the citys wastewater system other than the citys collection system c wholesale volume charge the city shall charge the district a wholesale volume charge equal to the districts volume of wastewater conveyed by the district to the citys wastewater treatment plant multiplied by the wholesale volumetric rate the wholesale volumetric rate shall be set by the common council taking into account the citys operation and maintenance costs other than those operation and maintenance costs related to the citys wastewater collection system and the volume of all wastewater treated at the wastewater treatment plant d billing dates and payment terms  the city will bill the district quarterly for services rendered invoices shall be due and paid in full within 40 days of the date of mailing payment received by the city after the due date will be subject to a three percent late payment charge   2 9202016 measurement  reimbursement of costs a flow measurement the city will measure the volume of wastewater the district conveys to the citys wastewater treatment facility using a city owned meter located in a metering manhole on the citys wastewater treatment plant property the city will periodically arrange for the testing and calibration of the flow meter equipment these costs will be spread over all the ratepayers   2 9202016 loss of eligible property status a a property loses its eligible property status if it converts from a single family residential use to a multifamily or condominium use unless the district pays any additional connection fees owed as a result of the conversion any conversion to multifamily or condominium use that increases the number of residential equivalents on a property shall be subject to additional connection fees b a property loses its eligible property status if it converts from an existing residential use to industrial or commercial use unless the district receives city common council approval for the conversion and the district pays any additional connection fees owed as a result of the conversion c a property loses its eligible property status if it discharges or will discharge wastewater that exceeds normal domestic strength wastewater unless the district receives city common council approval for the discharge of wastewater exceeding normal domestic strength waste from that property   2 9202016 conditions for continued wastewater treatment service  prohibitions a conditions the citys undertaking to provide wastewater treatment service to the district is conditioned on the district meeting and continuing to meet each one of the following conditions 1 the districts wastewater collection system must be constructed operated and maintained in compliance with federal and state requirements 2 the district as a user of the citys system must comply with the citys sewer use ordinance 3 the district must adopt maintain and enforce a sewer use ordinance for its users which is substantially similar to the citys sewer use ordinance 4 the wastewater discharged from the districts wastewater collection system to the citys wastewater treatment facility shall not exceed normal domestic strength wastewater as defined by the citys code of ordinances 5 the district must adhere to and enforce all state and local regulations regarding separation and elimination of clearwater from sanitary wastes 6 the district shall at its expense reduce infiltrationinflow into the districts wastewater collection system whenever such infiltration is in excess of any limits imposed or standards set by the wisconsin department of natural resources or the united states environmental protection agency 7 the district is responsible for notifying the wisconsin department of natural resources of a discharge to or from its wastewater system in violation of federal or state law or its wastewater discharge permit 8 the district is responsible for implementing a capacity management operation and maintenance program for its own wastewater system that satisfies the requirements of wis admin 23 9 the district shall immediately notify the city of any occurrence or situation that may adversely affect the wastewater treatment plant 10 the district shall submit all plans for sewer main extensions new lift stations or new force mains within the district to the city for the citys approval which approval shall not be unreasonably denied b specific prohibitions under no condition shall the district take the following actions 1 the district shall not convey wastewater generated or collected from properties other than eligible properties to the citys wastewater treatment facility 2 the district shall not convey wastewater generated from users outside of the eligible service area to the citys wastewater treatment facility 3 the district shall not transmit wastewater generated from a property for which a connection charge has not been paid to the city as specified in section  4 the district shall not transmit wastewater with greater than domestic strength waste to the citys wastewater treatment facility unless expressly approved by the common council 5 the district shall not permit septic waste seepage pit wastes greasetrap wastes lift station grease solids or any trucked liquid wastes or wastewater from unconnected properties or from properties in the process of abandonment to be deposited in its wastewater collection system and conveyed to the citys wastewater treatment facility   2 9202016 violations if it is determined by the city that the district has violated this article the city shall notify the district of the violation in writing and shall require the district to exercise its best efforts to cease and desist such action immediately  and in the event the district fails to take corrective action or in the alternate to satisfactorily assure the city that corrective action will be taken within a specified period of time the city is authorized to proceed to enforce the article using the enforcement process applicable to wastewater discharges set forth in the citys code of ordinances at section    2 9202016 chapter 1312  utilities purpose it is the intention of the city to require all utilities to be buried underground wherever it is consistent with the law and existing development   part 2005 utilities in existing plats and for other areas of the city of omro all telephone utility cable television and electrical cable hereafter installed outside of any city rightofway and which are to serve any residential commercial or industrial property in any areas of the city shall be buried underground this requirement shall include feeder cables and individual service connections the planning commission may waive this requirement for any of the following reasons 1 the location topography soil solid rock boulders or other physical conditions would make underground installation unreasonable or impractical  or 2 the lots to be served by the facilities can be served directly from existing overhead facilities   part 2005 utilities in municipal rightofway the common council may elect to require telephone utility cable television and electrical cable located within municipal rightsofway to be buried underground in any case where the common council requires underground installation of utilities the common council or a third party must agree to reimburse the utility for the difference in cost between the standard design or construction techniques of the utility and the cost of installation of utilities underground further the underground installation must be consistent with safe and reliable utility construction   part 2005 title 15  buildings and construction footnotes  1  state law reference one and twofamily dwelling authority relative to buildings and construction wis stats  10165 10176 10186   article 1  general provisions short title this chapter shall be known as the building the city of omro and will be referred to in this chapter as this chapter prior a    part 1997 purpose this chapter provides certain minimum standards provisions and requirements for safe and stable design methods of construction and uses of materials in buildings andor structures hereafter erected constructed enlarged altered repaired moved converted to other uses or demolished and regulates the equipment maintenance use and occupancy of all such buildings andor structures its purpose is to protect and foster the health safety and wellbeing of persons occupying or using such buildings and the general public prior b    part 1997 scope new buildings hereafter erected in or any building hereafter moved within or into the city shall conform to all the requirements of this chapter except as they are herein specifically exempted from part or all of its provisions any alteration enlargement or demolition of an existing building and any installation therein of electrical gas plumbing heating air conditioning ventilating or fire protection equipment which affects the health or safety of the users thereof or any other persons is a new building to the extent of such change any existing building shall be considered a new building for the purposes of this chapter whenever it is used for dwelling commercial or industrial purposes unless it was being used for such purpose at the time this chapter was enacted the provisions of this chapter supplement by the current laws of the state of wisconsin pertaining to the construction and use and which are adopted in their entirety also included is the zoning code of the city and amendments thereto to the date this chapter was adopted and in no way supersede or nullify such law and the zoning code prior c    part 1997 fees a building the fees for building electrical plumbing hvac heating ventilation and air conditioning and other related permits shall be as listed on the schedule posted in the city clerks office b triple fees if a required permit is not obtained prior to commencement of construction fees shall be tripled prior     part 1997 disclaimer on inspections a the purpose of the inspections under this chapter is to improve the quality of housing in the city the inspections and the reports and findings issued after the inspections are not intended as nor are they to be construed as a guarantee b in order to so advise owners and other interested persons the following disclaimer shall be applicable to all inspections these findings of inspection contained herein are intended to report conditions of noncompliance with code standards that are readily apparent at the time of inspection the inspection does not involve a detailed examination of the mechanical systems or the closed structural and nonstructural elements of the building and premises no warranty of the operation use or durability of equipment and materials not specifically cited herein is expressed or implied prior     part 1997 unsafe buildings a whenever the building inspector or other authorized inspector finds any building or part thereof within the city to be in hisher judgment so old dilapidated or out of repair as to be dangerous unsafe unsanitary or otherwise unfit for human occupancy or use and so that it would be unreasonable to repair the same the building inspector may order the owner to raze and remove such building or part thereof or if it can be made safe by repairs to repair and make safe and sanitary or to raze and remove at the owners option b the building inspector shall give specific reasons for hisher determination such order and proceedings shall be as provided in wis stats   prior     part 1997 article 2  codes adopted state uniform dwelling state the administrative code provisions describing and defining regulations with respect to one and twofamily dwellings in the wisconsin administrative adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth herein this includes new existing moved buildings alterations additions and accessory structures any act required to be performed or prohibited by an administrative code provision incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this chapter any future amendments revisions or modifications of the administrative code provisions incorporated herein are intended to be made part of this chapter to secure uniform statewide regulation of one and twofamily dwellings in the city a copy of these administrative code provisions and any future amendments shall be kept on file in the building inspectors office b existing buildings the wisconsin uniform dwelling also apply to buildings and conditions where 1 an existing building to be occupied as a one or twofamily dwelling which building was not previously so occupied  2 additions and alterations regardless of cost made to an existing building when deemed necessary in the opinion of the building inspector shall comply with the requirements of this chapter for new buildings any addition or alteration regardless of cost made to a building shall be made in conformity with applicable sections of this chapter  3 any structure moved to a new location c definitions as used in this chapter 1 addition means new construction performed on a dwelling which increases the outside dimensions of the dwelling 2 alteration means a substantial change or modification other than an addition or minor repair to a dwelling or to systems involved within a dwelling 3 department means the state of wisconsin department which is in charge of building codes 4 dwelling means a any building the initial construction of which is commenced on or after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived which contains one or two dwelling units  or b an existing structure or that part of an existing structure which is used or intended to be used as a one or twofamily dwelling 5 minor repair means repairs performed for maintenance or replacement purposes on any existing one or twofamily dwelling which does not affect room arrangement light and ventilation access to or efficiency of any exit stairways or exits fire protection or exterior aesthetic appearance and which does not increase a given occupancy and use no building permit is required for work to be performed which is deemed minor repair 6 one or twofamily dwelling means a building structure which contains one or separate households intended to be used as a home residence or sleeping place by an individual or by two or more individuals maintaining a common household to the exclusion of all others 7 person means an individual partnership firm or corporation 8 uniform dwelling those administrative code provisions and any future amendments revisions or modifications thereto contained in the chapters of the wisconsin administrative which deal with one or twofamily dwellings d method of enforcement 1 certification the building inspector shall be certified for inspection purposes by the department in each of the categories specified under the wisconsin administrative duties the building inspector shall administer and enforce all provisions of this chapter and the uniform dwelling inspection powers the building inspector or an authorized certified agent may at all reasonable hours enter upon any public or private premises for inspection purposes and may require the production of the permit for any building plumbing electrical or heating work no person shall interfere with or refuse to permit access to any such premises to the building inspector or hisher agent while in performance of hisher duties 4 records the building inspector shall perform all administrative tasks required by the department under the uniform dwelling addition the inspector shall keep a record of all applications for building permits and shall regularly number each permit in the order of its issue also a record showing the number description and size of all buildings erected indicating cost of each building and aggregate cost of all one and twofamily dwellings shall be kept the building inspector shall make a written annual report to the common council relative to these matters e alterations and additions to existing buildings 1 the provisions of the uniform dwelling shall apply to all alterations and additions of all one and twofamily dwellings regardless of the date of construction 2 additions and alterations shall include but are not limited to new rooms decks and porches whether roofed or not new siding that replaces old siding and new roofs where the rafters or sheathing are replaced prior     part 1997 state law reference one and twofamily dwelling code wis stats  10160 et seq  local authority wis stats  10165 construction standards codes a portions of state building the wisconsin state commercial building adopted and made a part of this chapter with respect to those classes of commercial buildings to which this building code specifically applies any future amendments revisions and modifications of any chapter incorporated herein are intended to be made a part of this copy of the commercial building code and amendments thereto shall be kept on file in the office of the building inspector b state plumbing the provisions and regulations of wis stats ch 145 and the wisconsin plumbing made a part of this chapter by reference and shall extend over and govern the installation of all plumbing installed altered or repaired in the city any further amendments revisions and modifications of the wisconsin state statutes and administrative code herein are intended to be made part of this chapter c electrical the national electrical the changes additions or omissions specified in the state of wisconsin electrical codes are made a part of this chapter by reference and shall extend over and govern the installation of all electrical work altered or repaired in the city any further amendments revisions and modifications of the administrative code and wisconsin state statutes herein are intended to be made part of this chapter d conflicts if in the opinion of the building inspector and the common council the provisions of the state commercial building by of this section shall conflict with the provisions of the federal housing administration standards in their application to any proposed building or structure the inspector andor the city shall apply the most stringent provisions in determining whether or not the proposed building meets the requirements of this section prior     part homes and mobile homes wis stats  10191 et seq  multifamily dwelling code wis stats   et seq  elevators escalators and other conveyances wis stats   et seq  local authority relative to buildings and construction wis stats  10165 10176 10186   article 3  permits permit required no building of any kind shall be moved within or into the city and no new building or structure or any part thereof shall hereafter be erected or ground broken for same or enlarged altered moved demolished razed or used within the city except as herein provided until a permit therefor shall first have been obtained by the owner or hisher authorized agent from the building inspector prior a1    part 1997 application application for a building permit shall be made in writing upon a form furnished by the building inspector or hisher designee and shall state the name and address of the owner of the land and also the owner of the building if different the legal description of the land upon which the building is to be located the name and address of the designer the use to which the building is to be put and such other information as the building inspector may require prior b    part 1997 site plan approval a submission required all applicants for building permits for any construction reconstruction expansion or conversion shall submit a site plan and sufficient plans and specifications of proposed buildings machinery and operations to enable the building inspector or hisher expert consultants to determine whether the proposed application meets all the requirements applicable thereto in this chapter b review the building inspector shall make a preliminary review of the application and plans requiring site plan review to determine whether the application and plans meet all the requirements applicable thereto in this chapter within 30 days of hisher receipt of the application the building inspector may issue or refuse a building permit applications for mobile home parks subdivisions planned unit developments manmade lakes or ponds and parking lots shall be reviewed and approved or denied by the planning commission c requirements for consideration in acting on any site plan the building inspector or the planning commission shall consider the following 1 the appropriateness of the site plan and buildings in relation to the physical character of the site and the usage of adjoining land areas  2 construction along highways shall be in accordance with the citys downtown revitalization ordinance and historical ordinance  3 the layout of the site with regard to entrances and exits to public streets  the arrangement and improvement of interior roadways  the location adequacy and improvement of areas for parking and for loading and unloading  and shall in this connection satisfy itself that the traffic pattern generated by the proposed construction or use shall be developed in a manner consistent with the safety of residents and the community and the applicant shall so design the construction or use as to minimize any traffic hazard created thereby  4 the adequacy of the proposed water supply drainage facilities and sanitary and waste disposal  5 the landscaping and appearance of the completed site the building inspector or the planning commission may require that those portions of all front rear and side yards not used for offstreet parking shall be attractively planted with trees shrubs plants or grass lawns and that the site be effectively screened so as not to impair the value of adjacent properties nor impair the intent of purposes of this section d effect on municipal services before granting any site approval the building inspector or the planning commission may besides obtaining advice from consultants secure such advice as may be deemed necessary from other municipal officials with special attention to the effect of such approval upon existing municipal services and utilities should additional facilities be needed the building inspector or the planning commission shall not issue the final approval until the city has entered into an agreement with the applicant regarding the development of such facilities e appeals denials of building permits contingent upon site plan approval may be appealed to the zoning board of appeals by filing a notice of appeal with the city clerk within 30 days of the denial f driveway requirements see prior c    part 1997 dedicated street and approved subdivision required unless a waiver is granted by the common council following a recommendation from the building inspector no building permit shall be issued unless the property on which the building is proposed to be built abuts a street that has been dedicated for street purposes no building permits shall be issued until the subdivision andor certified survey and required improvements are accepted by the common council prior d    part 1997 utilities required for residential and nonresidential buildings no building permit shall be issued for the construction of any building until sewer water storm sewer grading and streets are installed in the streets necessary to service the property for which the permit is repairs a waiver if the building inspector finds that the character of the work is sufficiently described in the application heshe may waive the filing of plans for alterations repairs or moving b minor repairs the building inspector may authorize minor repairs or maintenance work on any structure or to plumbing electrical heating ventilating or air conditioning systems installed which are valued at less than $100000 which do not change the occupancy area exterior aesthetic appearance structural strength fire protection exits light or ventilation of the building or structure without issuance of a building permit prior g    part 1997 approval of plans  permit issuance a if the building inspector determines that the building will comply with this chapter and with other applicable ordinances and orders of the city heshe shall issue a building permit which shall state the use to which the building is to be put which shall be kept and displayed at the site of the proposed building after being approved the plans and specifications shall not be altered in any respect which involves any of the above mentioned ordinances laws or orders or which involves the safety of the building or the occupants except with the written consent of the building inspector b in case adequate plans are presented for part of the building only the building inspector at hisher discretion may issue a permit for that part of the building before receiving the plans and specifications for the entire building prior h    part 1997 inspection of work the statecertified inspector is authorized and directed to administer and enforce all provisions of the wisconsin administrative to hisher certification the builder shall notify the building inspector when ready for inspections and the building inspector will inspect after notification all buildings at the following states of construction a footings  prior to placing concrete since ground under footings should not be unnecessarily exposed to rain groundwater snow or frost concrete can be placed four hours after notification even if inspection is not made in that case leave edge of the minimum eightinches wall footing exposed several places and edge of the minimum 12inches column and chimney footings exposed on one side of each on one or twofamily dwellings and the plan approved sizes on commercial buildings include three or more unit apartment buildings so it can be seen at the time of the foundation inspection b foundation walls after exterior drain tile gravel waterproofing and perimeter insulation and prior to back filling on dwellings basement foundations only on commercial buildings c under floor plumbing prior to interior back fill and floor this includes sump and drain tile d roughin after roofing siding subfloor plumbing pipes electrical wiring heating pipes andor ducts prior to interior wall and ceiling materials and insulation e insulation after insulation and vapor barrier prior to wall and ceiling materials f final prior to occupancy g inspections  inspections will be made within 48 hours of notification weekends and holidays excepted if the inspection is not made within this time construction can continue after the 48 hours is up prior i    part 1997 denial of access  inspection warrants if the building inspector is denied access to inspect a property heshe may request the city attorney to seek an inspection warrant pursuant to wis stats   prior j    part 1997 final inspection and compliance certificate a the building inspector shall make a final inspection of all new buildings additions and alterations b no building nor part thereof shall be occupied until such inspection has been made nor shall any building be occupied in any manner which conflicts with the conditions set forth in the permit the responsible party or parties whether the builder andor owner who occupies a building before the final inspection shall be subject to a citation along with other penalties as provided in this chapter it shall be the responsibility of the responsible party whether the builder andor owner to inform building tenants of the final inspection requirement c a compliance certificate will be issued upon request when the final inspection has been made and eventual nonconforming and missing items corrected prior k1    part 1997 electrical permits a except as otherwise provided by this chapter all installations of electrical equipment shall conform to and comply with the state electrical the wisconsin state statutes this chapter and any orders rules and regulations issued by authority thereof and with approved electrical standards for safety to persons and property where no specific standards for safety are prescribed by this chapter or by the state electrical conformity with the regulations set forth in the state electrical in the national electrical safety be prima facie evidence of conformity with approved standards for safety to persons and property b permit required before any electrical wires or electrical apparatus shall be installed for lighting or power purposes or any electrical construction work done except minor repair work a permit therefor shall be obtained from the building inspector by the owner or a licensed electrician a permit shall be on the same form used for building permits and shall state clearly the work planned alterations to be made and equipment and materials to be used and all later deviations from such plan must be submitted to and approved by the building inspector minor repair work means the replacement of broken or defective sockets snap push or toggle switches convenience outlets and portable electrical appliances c inspections electrical inspections are to be performed as outlined in d underground wiring required all telephone utility cable television and electric cable hereafter installed outside of any city rightofway and which are to serve residential commercial or industrial property shall be buried underground this requirement shall include feeder cables and individual service connections the electrical inspector may waive this requirement for any of the following reasons 1 the location topography soil solid rock boulders or other physical conditions would make underground installation unreasonable or impractical  or 2 the lots to be served by the facilities can be served directly from existing overhead facilities prior     part 1997  part 2005 state law reference electrical wiring and electricians wis stats  10180 et seq  local authority wis stats  10186 heating ventilating and air conditioning permits a except as otherwise provided by this chapter all installations of heating ventilating and air conditioning equipment shall comply with the state heating ventilating and air conditioning codes the wisconsin state statutes this chapter and any orders rules and regulations issued by authority thereof b permit required 1 before any piping duct or equipment shall be installed except for minor work a permit shall be obtained from the building inspector 2 the application for such permit will be on the same form used for a building permit and shall state clearly the work planned and material and equipment used and all later deviations must be submitted and approved by the building inspector c inspections heating ventilating and air conditioning inspections are to be performed as outlined in prior     part 1997 plumbing permits a permit to connect with public sewer system required no person firm or corporation shall open any street alley or public place for the purpose of connecting to a sewer lateral or other terminal lay any house sewer or drain pipe or make any attachment or extension to any old drain or house sewer or do any kind of work whatsoever in connection with any public or private sewer outside of any building except repairs without first obtaining from the city a written permit to connect with the public sewer system b permit required before laying drains no work of laying house sewers or storm drains that are on the premises and in the hands of a master plumber or one employed by himher shall be commenced or continued without the required permit all work on water and sewer laterals shall be performed by stateregistered plumbers or pipe layers c permit for interior plumbing 1 no interior plumbing work shall be started before obtaining a permit from the building inspector as outlined in this section 2 all plumbing work inside the foundation of any commercial building duplex or multifamily building and inside any new singlefamily dwelling shall be performed by a master plumber or a journeyman plumber working under the masters direction d application for permit a permit shall be granted only upon written application by a licensed master plumber authorized by the owner or agent of the premises desiring to make such connection extension or alteration and stating the name of the owner and that heshe and such master plumber will be bound by and be subject to all the rules and regulations prescribed and giving the exact location of the premises stating the purpose for which the connection extension or alteration is to be used and the time when the work is to be done and all other particulars in respect thereto prior b    part 1997 permit lapses a building permit shall lapse and be void unless building operations are commenced and construction has not been substantially completed within two years from the date of issuance thereof prior l    part 1997 revocation of permits a the building inspector or other authorized inspectors may revoke any building plumbing heating ventilation air conditioning or electrical permit or approval issued under the regulations of this chapter and may stop construction or use of approved new materials equipment methods of construction devices or appliances for any of the following reasons 1 whenever the building inspector shall find at any time that applicable ordinances laws orders plans and specifications are not being complied with and that the holder of the permit refused to conform after written warning has been issued to himher  2 whenever the continuance of any construction becomes dangerous to life or property  3 whenever there is any violation of any condition or provisions of the application for permit or of the permit  4 whenever any false statement or misrepresentation has been made in the application for permit plans drawings data specifications or certified lot or plot plan on which the issuance of the permit or approval was based  5 whenever there is a violation of any of the conditions of an approval or occupancy given by the building inspector for the proper use of all materials equipment methods or construction devices or appliances b the notice revoking a building electrical heating ventilation air conditioning or plumbing permit or approval shall be in writing and may be served upon the applicant of the permit owner of the premises and hisher agent if any and on the person having charge of construction c a revocation placard shall also be posted upon the building structure equipment or premises in question by the building inspector d after the notice is served upon the persons as aforesaid and posted it is unlawful for any person to proceed thereafter with any construction operation whatsoever on the premises and the permit which has been so revoked shall be null and void and before any construction or operation is again resumed a new permit as required by this chapter shall be procured and fees paid therefor and thereafter the resumption of any construction or operation shall be in compliance with the regulation of this chapter however such work as the inspector may order as a condition precedent to the reissuance of the building permit may be performed or such work as heshe may require for preservation of life and safety prior m    part 1997 report of violations city officers shall report at once to the building inspector any building which is being carried on without a permit as required by this chapter prior n    part 1997 display of permit building permits shall be displayed in a conspicuous place on the premises where the authorized building or work is in progress at all times during construction or work thereon prior o    part 1997 article 4  additional regulations accessory buildings a general accessory buildings shall include but are not limited to unattached garages sheds storage buildings and boathouses b design accessory buildings shall be designed and finished to be compatible with the primary structure by using similar building methods materials and colors c methods of design 1 generally those applicable design requirements set forth in the wisconsin dwelling which apply directly to the major structural components of accessory buildings shall be used in the design of such buildings 2 exceptions a small utility buildings of the portable type and size commonly available as a single unit or kit need not comply with of this section if in the opinion of the building inspector such buildings are considered safe and sound b wall studs for garages may be spaced 24 inches on center d foundations 1 generally all accessory buildings shall be built on either foundation floating slabs or piers subject to approval of the building inspector 2 exception buildings of the type described in a of this section may be placed on skids or other similar supports anchored to the ground subject to approval of the building inspector e grade the grade shall slope away from the accessory building to provide drainage away from the building prior     part 1997 plumbing inspections a all plumbing systems or installations within the boundaries of the city and those connecting with the city water or sewerage system beyond the boundaries are subject to inspection as required in this chapter b system of inspection plumbing installations inspections will be performed by the following personnel 1 building inspector as outlined in of this chapter for piping and appliances inside structures 2 chief utility operator sanitary sewer laterals and water laterals shall be inspected by the utility sewer and water operator 3 public works storm sewer laterals shall be inspected by the public works department prior a1 and 2    part 1997 repairs to drainage or waste pipes  responsibility of property owners repairs of any drainage or waste pipe carrying domestic sewage from outside the foundation walls of any building or structure to the sewer main including private domestic sewage treatment and disposal systems such as stoppage of leaks in supply or waste pipes clearing stoppages in waste pipes and repairing valves or faucets in the drainage or waste pipe shall be the sole responsibility of the property owner and repairs of water pipes from outside the foundation walls to the curb stop shall be the sole responsibility of the property owner prior a3    part 1997 excavations a protection of excavations when a building permit for any building which includes in its plans the excavation for a basement or subsurface construction has been issued by the building inspector it shall be understood that if at any time for any cause after such excavation work shall have commenced subsequent work shall be discontinued for more than 30 days such owner shall erect all around such excavation a solid barrier wall or wire fence not less than five feet in height which barrier wall or wire fence shall remain in position until work is again commenced and the building inspector is satisfied it will be completed b notice to owner if any excavation made comes to the attention of the building inspector and appears to have been discontinued or abandoned the building inspector shall notify the owner in writing by registered mail that within 30 days of receipt of such notice such owner shall erect a solid suitable wall barrier or wire fence around such excavation or cap same to eliminate the danger of any person falling therein or continue construction such landowner shall upon receipt of such notice erect such wall wire fence or barrier or cap such excavation any failure to do so shall constitute a violation of this section unless construction work is immediately continued such wall wire fence or barrier or capping shall remain in place until the building inspector is satisfied that the removal of the same will be followed by normal and ordinary construction operations c excavations near street whenever any person whether as owner of any premises or hisher agent or contractor desires to make an excavation thereon within four feet of any public street or sidewalk heshe shall place and maintain proper barriers around same until such excavation shall be filled d notice to adjoining owner whenever an excavation is to be so deep that adjoining walls have to be underpinned the general contractor shall give adjoining property owners notification of that fact see the wisconsin administrative sheath piling all excavations for buildings shall be properly guarded and protected by the excavator and shall be sheath piled whenever necessary to prevent the adjoining soil from caving in f closing of abandoned excavations 1 if the landowner fails to comply with the terms of such agreement or after having been notified as herein provided fails or refuses to comply with the terms of this section the building inspector shall cause such excavation to be fenced or capped whichever shall be more economical at the citys expense shall keep a record of costs thereof and certify same to the city administrator who shall place such cost on the tax roll as a charge against the affected real estate and same shall be collected as are other city special charges 2 any excavation for building purposes or any uncovered foundation which shall remain open for more than 45 days shall be deemed abandoned and a nuisance the building inspector shall order that unless the erection of the building or structure on the excavation or foundation shall commence or continue forthwith suitable safeguards shall be provided to prevent accidental injury to children or others or the excavation or foundation be filled to grade an order shall be served upon the owner of record or the owners agent who is in charge of the premises and upon the holder of an encumbrance of record in the manner provided for service of a summons in the circuit court if the owner or the holder of an encumbrance of record cannot be found the order may be served by posting it on the premises and making publication in the official newspaper for two consecutive publications at least ten days before the time for compliance stated in the order commences to run such time shall be not less than 14 days nor more than 20 days after service if the owner of the land fails to comply with the order within the time required the building inspector shall cause the excavation or foundation to be filled to grade the cost of such abatement shall be charged against the real estate and entered on the next succeeding tax roll as a special charge and shall bear interest at a rate established by council from the date of the building inspectors report on cost thereof pursuant to the provisions of wis stats   prior af    part 1997 vacant buildings whenever any building or structure is vacant and the doors and windows or any part thereof have been removed or opened leaving the interior of such building or structure exposed to the elements and accessible to trespassers then such building or structure shall be deemed to be dangerous unsafe and a menace to public safety the building inspector shall give the owner thereof written notice to secure the building or structure and comply with city code requirements within 30 days of the date of the notice failure to comply with the written notice shall be sufficient grounds for the building inspector to condemn and raze the building or structure in accordance with the applicable provisions of wis stats   prior g    part 1997 alterations and repairs the following provisions shall apply to buildings altered or repaired a alterations when not in conflict with any regulations alterations to any existing building or structure accommodating a legal occupancy and use but of substandard type of construction which involves either beams girders columns bearing or other walls room heating and air condition systems plumbing and electrical systems arrangement light and ventilation changes in location of exit stairways or exits or any or all of the above then such existing construction shall be made to conform to the minimum requirements of this chapter applicable to such occupancy and use and given type of construction b repairs repairs for purposes of maintenance or replacements in any existing building or structure which do not involve the structural portions of the building or structure or which do not affect room arrangement plumbing electrical and hvac systems light and ventilation access to or efficiency of any existing stairways or exits fire protection or exterior aesthetic appearance and which do not increase a given occupancy or use shall be deemed minor repairs and if total cost of materials is less than $100000 it will not require a permit c alterations when not permitted when any existing building or structure which for any reason whatsoever does not conform to the regulations of this chapter has deteriorated from any cause whatsoever to an extent greater than 50 percent of the equalized value of the building or structure no alterations or moving of such building or structure shall be permitted any such building or structure shall be considered a menace to public safety and welfare and shall be ordered vacated and thereafter demolished and debris removed from the premises d alterations and repairs required when any of the structural members of any building or structure have deteriorated from any cause whatsoever to less than their required strength the owner of such a building or structure shall cause such structural members to be restored to their required strength  failing in which the building or structure shall be considered a menace to public safety and shall be vacated and thereafter no further occupancy or use of the same shall be permitted until the regulations of this chapter are complied with e extent of deterioration the amount and extent of deterioration of any existing building or structure shall be determined by the building inspector prior a2    part 1997 grades to be established for new construction for new construction adjacent to existing buildings the city engineer shall establish the finish grade elevation such that the elevation corresponds with surrounding buildings for new plats the city engineer shall establish the finish elevation for each structure which corresponds to the drainage plan provided for such plat prior a3    part 1997  part 2003 use discontinued a whenever any building or portion thereof is being used or occupied contrary to the provisions of this chapter the building inspector shall order such use or occupancy discontinued and the building or portion thereof vacated by notice served on any person using or causing such use or occupancy to be continued and such person shall vacate such building or portion thereof within 30 days after receipt of the notice or make the building or portion thereof comply with the requirements of this chapter b any building structure premises or any part thereof hereafter vacated or damaged by any cause whatsoever so as to jeopardize public safety or health shall not hereafter be occupied or used until a new permit application has been filed and a new final inspection made prior k2    part 1997 change of use  approval required it is unlawful to change the use of any building structure premises or part thereof without first obtaining from the building inspector an approval of such change in the occupancy or use prior k3    part 1997 razing of buildings a permit required no building within the city shall be razed without a permit from the building inspector a snow fence or other approved barricade shall be provided as soon as any portion of the building is removed and shall remain during razing operations after all razing operations have been completed the foundation shall be filled at least one foot above the adjacent grade the property raked clean and all debris hauled away razing permits shall lapse and be void unless the work authorized thereby is commenced within six months from the date thereof or completed within 30 days from the date of commencement of the work any unfinished portion of work remaining beyond the required 30 days must have special approval from the building inspector b debris removal all debris must be hauled away at the end of each week for the work that was done during that week no combustible material shall be used for back filling but shall be hauled away there shall not be any burning of materials on the site of the razed building c dust if any razing or removal operation under this section results in or would likely result in an excessive amount of dust particles in the air creating a nuisance in the vicinity thereof the permittee shall take all necessary steps by use of water spraying or other appropriate means to eliminate such nuisance d insects and rodents the permittee shall take all necessary steps prior to the razing of a building employment of a qualified person in the field of pest control or by other appropriate means to treat the building as to prevent the spread and migration of rodents and insects therefrom during and after the razing operations e asbestos state regulations regarding abatement of asbestos shall be followed f basement concrete floors about five percent of the floor shall be removed to allow drainage g utilities all utilities shall be cut and capped as directed by the utility company or the city water and sewer department prior     part 1997 discharge of clear waters a groundwater discharge where deemed necessary by the building inspector every house shall have a sump pump installed for the purpose of discharging clear waters from foundation drains and ground infiltration with discharge pipe penetrating the exterior wall above the grade and the underground pipe connected to the storm sewer lateral which is provided by the developer at the front lot line and where the building is not serviced by a storm sewer shall either discharge into an underground conduit leading to a drainage ditch dry well gutter or shall discharge onto the ground surface in such other manner as will not constitute a nuisance as defined herein no water shall be discharged within eight feet of a neighboring lot or in such a manner that water will enter a neighboring lot b conducting tests  if the building inspector or a sewer department employee suspects an illegal clear water discharge as defined by this chapter or by any other applicable provision of the wisconsin administrative it may from time to time be amended heshe may upon reasonable notice and at reasonable times enter the private premises where such illegal clear water discharge is suspected and conduct appropriate tests to determine whether such suspected illegal clear water discharge actually exists c stormwater discharge all roof downspouts from gutters serving roofs larger than 600 square feet measured horizontally or which discharge unto paved areas surface drains from any mechanical devices pipes conduits or any other objects or things used for the purpose of collecting conducting transporting diverting draining or discharging of storm waters shall be discharged to a storm sewer lateral if storm sewer provided in street or to a dry well an underground conduit leading to a drainage ditch or onto the ground surface in such other manner as will not constitute a nuisance as defined herein d storm sewer lateral where municipal storm sewers are provided a lateral shall be installed to the lot line and underground piping from the building to the lateral shall be at the expense of the owner prior   cf  part 1997 floodplain requirements a the full requirements are listed in the existing floodplain ordinance b as an interpretation of some of the requirements the following should be noted 1 the floor in the lowest room and the top of the foundation wall shall be at least two feet above the 100year floodplain elevation basements are not allowed and for the purposes of this chapter a crawlspace with more than three feet from floor to underside of floor joists or trusses shall be considered a basement 2 outside drain tile should not be installed and no opening allowed or foundation walls below two feet above the 100year floodplain elevation 3 no furnaces hot water tanks electrical devices nonsubmersible pumps standpipes or drains connected to the sanitary sewer or other equipment are allowed below the 100year floodplain elevation 4 rim of clear water sump shall be flush with the floor 5 floor in crawlspace shall not be lower than the 100year floodplain elevation prior     part 1997 construction site erosion and stormwater runoff control a except as otherwise specifically provided in this provisions of the wisconsin construction site best management practice handbook are adopted and by reference and made a part of this if fully set forth herein b the erosion control measures required by the state building codes shall be followed prior     part 1997 article 5  violations  penalties violations  penalties a any building or structure hereafter erected enlarged altered or repaired or any use hereafter established in violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed an unlawful building structure or use the building inspector or other authorized inspectors shall promptly report all such violations to the council and city attorney who shall bring an action to enjoin the erection enlargement alteration repair or moving of such building or structure or the establishment of such use of buildings in violation of this chapter or to cause such building structure or use to be removed and may also be subject to a penalty as provided in general penalty provisions of this any such action the fact that a permit was issued shall not constitute a defense nor shall any error oversight or dereliction of duty on the part of the building inspector or other city officials constitute a defense compliance with the provisions of this chapter may also be enforced by injunctional order at the suit of the owner or owners of any real estate within the jurisdiction of this chapter b violations 1 if an inspection reveals a noncompliance with this chapter or the uniform dwelling the building inspector shall notify the applicant and the owner in writing of the violation to be corrected all cited violations shall be corrected within 30 days after written notification unless an extension is granted 2 a stopwork order may be posted at the construction site a stopwork order shall not be removed except by written notice of the building inspector after satisfactory evidence has been supplied that the cited violation has been corrected 3 each day each violation continues after the 30 day written notice period has run shall constitute a separate offense nothing in this chapter shall preclude the city from maintaining any appropriate action to prevent or remove a violation of any provision of this chapter or the uniform dwelling if any construction or work governed by the provisions of this chapter or the uniform dwelling commenced prior to the issuance of a permit triple fees shall be charged c any person feeling aggrieved by an order or a determination of the building inspector may appeal from such order or determination to the zoning board of appeals those procedures customarily used to effectuate an appeal to the zoning board of appeals shall apply d except as may otherwise be provided by statute or ordinance no officer agent or employee of the city charged with the enforcement of this chapter shall render himselfherself personally liable for any damage that may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of hisher duties under this chapter any suit brought against any officer agent or employee of the city as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of hisher duties under this chapter shall be defended by the legal representative of the city until the final determination of the proceedings therein prior     part 1997 chapter 1508  housing code footnotes  3  state law reference ordinances placing certain limits or requirements on landlords wis stats   short title this chapter shall be known and cited as the minimum housing the city of omro prior     part 1997 purpose the purpose of this chapter is to prevent the deterioration of residential units in neighborhoods and to ensure a minimum level of housing standards for the residents of the city prior     part 1997 scope and construction a this chapter shall pertain to all dwellings b such units or neighborhoods
